title: Apricot Raspberry Tart
description: Mix the flour with the almonds. Make a well in the center and add the egg, lemon zest and 3 tablespoons honey. Add the cold butter in small pieces on the edge of the flour and knead all ingredients quickly into a dough. Form into a ball, wrap in plastic wrap and let rest for 30 minutes in the refrigerator. Grease tart pan with butter and sprinkle with breadcrumbs. Add dough and press into the pan. Dock the dough with a fork several times. Bake crust for about 20 minutes and let cool on a wire rack. Soften the gelatin in cold water. Pick over the raspberries. Rinse apricots, place in a bowl and pour boiling water over the fruit. Let stand 2 minutes, rinse with cold water, peel, halve and remove pits. Cut fruit into slices. Layer alternating circles of apricot slices and raspberries on the cooled crust. Mix water with white wine and remaining honey and heat until warm. Add the squeezed gelatin and cook while stirring to dissolve (do not boil!). Let mixture cool slightly, then pour over the fruit and spread smooth. Chill for at least 1 hour. Before serving, sprinkle with pistachios.

title: Rhubarb Gratin with Orange
description: Rinse and dry rhubarb, cut into 2 cm (approximately 3/4 inch) long pieces. Separate eggs. Beat egg whites with a pinch of salt until stiff. Whisk egg yolks with quark, sugar and custard powder until foamy. Fold in egg whites. Line the bottom of a shallow baking dish (about 2.5 liters capacity) (approximately 10 cups) with biscuits and drizzle with orange juice. Spread half of cream on biscuits. Arrange rhubarb pieces and top with remaining cream. Bake in preheated oven at 180°C (approximately 350°F) for 25-30 minutes. Immediately after baking, dust with powdered sugar and serve warm.

title: Fruit-Marshmallow Skewers
description: Rinse fruit (except for the banana) and trim. Cut the nectarines in half, remove the pits and cut the flesh into bite-sized pieces. Peel the banana and cut into bite-sized pieces. Alternately thread with the marshmallows, nectarines and strawberries onto skewers and grill until golden brown on the hot grill while turning. Serve drizzled with honey to taste.

title: Frozen Mango and Coconut Tart
description: Chill 4 tart tins (6 cm diameter) (approximately 2 inches). Soak 1 leaf of gelatin in cold water. Peel the mango, cut into thin slices away from the central pit.

title: Whole Wheat Waffles with Cherry Compote and Dark Chocolate Sauce
description: Once you've mastered this recipe, try it out different variations of the compote. Strawberries and blueberries are particularly delicious in this recipe.

title: Fruit Kebabs
description: If you don't have skewers, you can always serve this recipe in a bowl resembling a fruit salad!

title: Strawberry Sorbet
description: Beat the egg yolks, sugar, cardamom and vanilla sugar over a hot water bath until creamy (do not over heat). Then remove from the heat, beat until cool and stir in strawberry puree. Beat the cream until stiff and fold into the mixture. Finish in an ice cream maker or freeze in a shallow container in the freezer, stirring occasionally.

title: Yogurt Berry Dessert
description: Pick over berries (keeping some for garnish) and add to the yogurt. Stir vigorously to combine the fruit with the yogurt.

title: Citrus Yogurt with Coconut
description: Toast coconut until golden brown in a frying pan. Coarsely chop half.

title: Poached Pears with Chilli and Rosemary
description: Peel the pears and cut out the cores. Juice the lemon and add to the wine mixture, together with the pears. Cover and simmer for 2-3 minutes gently, then remove from the heat and let cool. From time to time stir gently so that all the pears are coated evenly. Let cool slightly and serve in bowls.

title: Pears with Chocolate Sauce
description: Remove pears and let cool. Strain marinade through a sieve and  reduce, simmering, to 50 ml (approximately 1/5 cup).

title: Easy Green Tea Granita
description: Squeeze the lime, and add the juice to the tea.

title: Sweet Berry Soup with Cashews
description: You can substitute sugar for honey or maple syrup. This could be a dessert or served over a bowl of oats in the morning for a filling breakfast.

title: Stracciatella Cream with Strawberries

title: Rice Pudding with Cherries
description: Rinse, drain and pit cherries.

title: Pear Cheesecake
description: For the topping: Separate the eggs. In a bowl, beat the egg whites until stiff. In another bowl, whisk together the egg yolks, quark, creme fraiche, sugar, vanilla sugar, cornstarch, cloves and ginger. Gently fold in the beaten egg whites.

description: Serve with garnished with mint and salty chocolate sticks.

description: Meanwhile, peel oranges and separate segments, collect juice and squeeze out residual pulp. Combine juice, mascarpone, quark, remaining milk and 2 tablespoons sugar.

title: Strawberry Jello with Vanilla Cream
description: For the cream, boil the milk and cream with slit vanilla pod. Remove from heat. Mix egg yolks with sugar in a bowl until creamy. Slowly add warm cream to the egg mixture in a thin stream stirring constantly. Pour everything back into the pot and cook over low heat, stirring constantly until creamy. Do not boil the custard. Remove the vanilla pod and allow custard to cool, stirring occasionally.

title: Baked Apples with Vanilla and Tarragon
description: Rinse the apples, cut a lid off each and cut out the core. Chop hazelnuts, raisins and plucked tarragon leaves, then mix with the butter and the honey. Fill apples with the mixture and put apples in buttered jars of an appropriate size. Drizzle with the lemon juice and the syrup and seal the jars. Put into the water and bake in the oven about 40 minutes.

title: Cheesecake with Candied Fruit
description: Add the lemon zest and juice to the mixture, then stir in the cheese. Sift together the flours, cornstarch and baking powder, then add to the batter in spoonfuls. Finally, fold the hardboiled egg whites into the batter and pour evenly into the pan. Bake in a preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clear, about 45-60 minutes. Remove and let cool.

title: Strawberry Soup with Egg White Balls
description: For the balls: pour water (up to 4 cm) (approximately 1 1/2 inches) in a wide pot, bring to a boil. Beat egg whites with salt and sugar until stiff. With 2 tablespoons, take out egg whites' balls and gently slide into water and cover. Turn off heat and let stand for 3 minutes, turn over egg whites' balls and let stand for 3 more minutes. Pour cold soup into bowls. With a slotted spoon, take out egg white balls and place on top of soup.

title: Pear Feta Towers
description: Drain the pears and cut them crosswise into finger-thick slices. Brush the two largest slices with the cheese-butter mixture, then top with two next largest slices and more cheese-butter mixture, continuing until topping with the smallest slices. Sprinkle with toasted oatmeal.

title: Cherry Rice Pudding
description: Pour cherries through a sieve and leave to drain.

title: Muffin Hedgehog
description: Whisk egg and mix with honey, vegetable oil and buttermilk and stir into flour mixture. Pour dough into muffin tins and bake for about 25 minutes. Let muffins rest for 5 minutes in baking tray, then remove and let cool completely. Coarsely chop chocolate, melt over a bowl of hot water and spread over muffins. Dry on a wire rack. Garnish with almonds and pearls as desired and serve.

title: Gingerbread Cake with Berries
description: For the cake: Place gingerbread (not wafers) in a blender and finely chop. Boil with cream and cornstarch in a pan while stirring until a smooth paste is formed. Remove from heat and let cool. Separate eggs and beat yolks with half of the icing sugar in a bowl over hot water until frothy. Stir in gingerbread mixture, lemon juice and allspice. Whip egg whites until stiff peaks form and fold gently into batter.
types: ['Bitesize', 'Winter spice treat', 'Spice Cake', 'Sponge Cake', 'Gingerbread Dough', 'cake batter', 'Gratin', 'Advent', 'Christmas', 'Christmas', 'Christmas Dessert', 'festively', 'Gourmet', 'Fruit', 'Sauce', 'Sweet Sauce', 'Menu', 'Dessert', 'dessert']

title: Fried Cherries
description: Separate eggs. Stir flour and milk in a bowl until smooth. Mix in yolks, butter and lemon zest to form a thick batter. Let it rest for about 10 minutes.

title: Strawberry, Honeydew and Kiwi Salad with Almonds
description: Rinse and hull the strawberries and depending on the size quarter or halve.

title: Carpaccio of Strawberries and Oranges
description: Heat the orange juice with white wine and honey (do not boil) and season with cardamom. Drizzle the warm syrup evenly over the fruit and let stand about  30 min. Serve garnished with cardamom pods.

title: Plum Soup with Braided Spelt Bread
description: Preheat the oven to 180°C (approximately 350°F).

title: Rice Pudding with Saffron and Strawberry Compote
description: Place the rice with milk, butter, lemon zest and saffron threads in a pot and bring to a boil, stirring constantly. Then turn off the heat, cover and let the rice sit for about 25 minutes. Season with about 50 grams (approximately 2 ounces) of sugar.

title: Semolina Pudding with Strawberries
description: Bring the milk with the butter, the vanilla bean, sugar and salt to a boil. Sprinkle in semolina and bring to boil while stirring constantly. Remove from the heat and let the semolina swell for a few minutes. Stir the well drained gelatine and the yolks into the  warm porridge. Beat egg whites until very stiff and fold into the slightly cooled semolina cream. Rinse 4 pudding molds under cold water and pour in mixture. Allow to chill for at least 2 hours.

title: Flambé Crepe
description: For the crepes, stir all ingredients to form a dough and fry in a pan with melted butter, making approximately 8 pancakes. Remove and drain on parchment paper. Meanwhile, wash the blueberries, drain and set aside 2 tablespoons for decoration. With the remaining blueberries, combine with 2 tablespoons sugar and mix with yogurt, and add 1 tablespoon of this mixture into each crepe, then close the crepes to form a pouch, twisting the top slightly to close. Mix the apricots with a little juice puree and mix with Calvados. Place a crepe on serving plate, pour the fruit and Calvados mixture on top and serve on fire.

title: Chocolate-Dipped Walnut Cookies
description: Beat the butter and sugar until fluffy then gradually stir in 6 eggs.

title: Flemish Style Rice Casserole Dessert
description: Rinse fresh lemon in hot water, wipe dry and grate zest. Finely chop half of zest. Separate eggs. Combine egg whites with salt and lemon juice, beat until stiff. Beat egg yolks with butter and sugar until fluffy. Combine yolks and chopped lemon zest with rice. Fold in egg whites. Pour mixture into a buttered baking dish and bake in preheated oven at 180°C (approximately 350°F) for about 40-50 minutes. Take out of the oven, cool slightly and serve sprinkle with powered sugar and garnished with remaining lemon zest.

title: Baked Apples Stuffed with Nuts and Jam
description: Rinse apples and core with an apple corer from the bottoms. Cut out star-shaped openings around the stems and hollow apples. Close bottom holes of apples with marzipan and place apples into a baking pan.

title: Chocolate and Mixed Berry Tart
description: Preheat the oven to 180°C (approximately 350°F). Roll out the pastry on a floured work surface and cut out 4 circles about 20 cm (approximately 7-8 inches) in diameter.

title: Rice Pudding with Raspberry Sauce
description: For the sauce, sort raspberries and bring to a boil in a saucepan with the lemon juice, sugar and 3-4 tablespoons of water. Strain through a sieve and let cool.

title: Strawberry Trifle with Vanilla Cream
description: Run lime under hot water, pat dry, remove half of the zest and set aside. Finely grate remaining zest  and then squeeze juice. Combine lime juice with honey and strawberries and let stand for about 10 minutes.
types: ['Dessert', 'Low-fat Dessert', 'non-alcoholic', 'In a jar', 'Meal for Four', 'Guest', 'Sweet', 'weekend cooking', 'Dairy', 'Fruit', 'Cream', 'Strawberry cream', 'Strawberry Trifle', 'Strawberry Dessert', 'Fruit Dessert', 'dessert']

title: Dessert Pasta with Berry-cream Sauce
description: Sort through berries, rinse if necessary and let drain. Whisk yogurt with vanilla sugar and lemon juice until smooth. Whip cream to soft peaks and fold into yogurt.

title: Biscuit and Custard with Mixed Berries
description: Separate egg. Beat egg white with 1 pinch of salt and 15 grams (approximately 0.5 ouce) of sugar until stiff. Beat egg yolk with remaining sugar and 1 tablespoon of hot water until frothy. Fold half of egg white into egg yolk mixture. Combine flour and cornstarch in a bowl. Sift half of flour over egg white and egg yolk mixture. Fold in remaining egg white and sift remaining flour over mixture.Add lime zest, ground pistachios and mint, mix gently. Pour into a small baking dish lined with baking paper (about 18 cm) (approximately 7 inches) and bake in preheated oven at 180°C (approximatley 350°F) on middle rack for about 12 minutes or until browned. Loosen biscuit from dish, remove baking paper and let cool on rack.

title: Apple Pancakes
description: Peel the apples, core and cut into thin columns. Immediately toss with lemon juice.

title: Gratin with Summer Fruit
description: Rinse peaches and plums, cut in half, remove seeds and cut into cubes. Rinse blackberries and drain. Mix the fruits together and place in a baking dish. Mix mascarpone with 2 tablespoons sugar. Separate egg and beat the egg white until stiff. Fold into the mascarpone mixture. Beat egg yolk with the lemon zest and the cream. Stir in 2 tablespoons sugar. Divide the mascarpone mixture evenly over the fruit. Pour yolk-cream mixture over. Sprinkle with the remaining sugar. Bake in preheated oven until the sugar starts to brown, about 25 minutes. Serve hot.

title: Champagne Cream Tart with Berries
description: Line a springform pan with parchment paper, roll out the pastry and line the mold with it, forming an edge around the outside. Place parchment paper and beans on top of the dough and blind bake for about 10 minutes in the preheated oven. Remove from the oven and take the beans and paper off of the base.

title: Peach and Strawberry Salad
description: Mix the strawberries in a bowl with the mint leaves, 2 tablespoons lemon juice and 1 tablespoon of agave syrup, then divide among 4 tall glasses, leaving approximately 8 tablespoons of strawberries in the bowl.

title: Sweet Risotto with Strawberries

description: For the filling: Cut bacon into small cubes. Peel and finely chop onions. Rinse apples and rub dry. Cut a lid off of each apple. With an apple corer, remove cores, leaving bottoms of apples intact. Enlarge opening slightly and sprinkle with lemon juice. Melt 1/2 tablespoon butter in a pan. Add bacon and onions. Cook, stirring, until onions are translucent. Season with pepper and stuff mixture into apples. Place lids on apples. Wrap each apple with a slice of bacon and secure with a toothpick. Place apples in a buttered baking dish and top with 2 tablespoons butter (cut into pieces). Brush with remaining butter and bake about 25 minutes. Remove and transfer apples to plates.

description: For the meringues: Whip the egg whites with the salt and lemon juice until very stiff. Stream in the powdered sugar and beat until the mixture is stiff and glossy. Bake in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes. Remove and let cool.

title: Creamy Cake with Cranberries
description: For the filling: soak gelatine in plenty of cold water. Puree cranberries and strain through a sieve. Combine with sugar and quark. Squeeze gelatine and dissolve on low heat in a small pot, add to quark mixture and mix well. Beat whipping cream until stiff and fold into cream. Place cake base into a cake ring and spread with half of cream. Replace top half of the cake and spread with remaining cream, smooth. For the topping: soak gelatine in water and squeeze. title: Apple Compote
description: Bring the water, lemon juice, lemon zest, sugar (to taste), cinnamon stick, cloves and raisins to boil in a pot. Add the apples and simmer over medium heat until the apple pieces are soft but not falling apart (cooking time may vary depending on the type of apple). Remove from the heat and let cool. Remove the cinnamon stick and cloves from the compote.

description: Bring milk with a pinch of salt to a boil, add rice, stir in saffron and cook, covered, on lowest heat for about 25 minutes. Simmer until rice is tender and all liquid is almost absorbed. Add rose water and raisins, pour into serving bowls, sprinkle with cinnamon and serve hot or cold.

Add vanilla seeds and lemon peel to the pot and bring to a boil. Add rhubarb to the pot and boil again, then remove from heat, add raspberries, mix in gently and cool slightly.

title: Layered Dessert with Rice and Fruit
description: Place one tablespoon of rice into four glasses, top with some mango slices. Next layer 2 tablespoons of rice and some melon slices. Again layer 2 tablespoons of rice and some strawberry slices. Repeat layers until all fruit slices are used and rice becomes top layer. Sprinkle with diced fruit.

description: Rinse, peel and cut the rhubarb into pieces.

title: Yogurt and Granola with Strawberries
description: In serving glasses, create successive layers of strawberries, yogurt and granola, layering again with strawberries and yogurt. Add some more granola on top and garnish with the remaining strawberries.

description: Form the chocolate mixture into large eggs with two tablespoons. Roll the eggs first in the hazelnuts, then in the coconut and put them on eggcups. Fill a piping bag with the rest of the chocolate mixture and pipe a hood on the chocolate eggs.

title: Strawberry Mousse
description: Combine apple juice, 50 ml (approximately 1/3 cup) of strawberry syrup and 20 grams (approximately 3/4 ounce) of sugar and bring to a boil. Cook rhubarb in it for 3 minutes, cool. Combine orange and lime juice, strawberry liqueur, remaining strawberry syrup and 20 grams (approximately 3/4 ounce) of sugar and bring to a boil. Cool and add cold butter cut into pieces. Arrange rhubarb and strawberries on plates, place orange butter over fruit and top with strawberry cream. Chop mint finely. Garnish with mint and grated coconut. Serve.

title: Strawberries and Cream Parfaits

Pour into well-chilled dessert glasses and alternately layer with the strawberry mixture, ending with quark. Garnish with remaining strawberries. Chop pistachios finely, sprinkle over the parfaits and serve.

title: Plum Mousse
description: Add ginger syrup to plum mixture. Soak gelatin in 50 ml (approximately 1/5 cup) of water. Add lemon juice. Add lemon gelatin mix to plum mixture. Add yogurt, mix well. Whip cream. title: Frozen Strawberry Soufflé
description: Rinse and stem the strawberries. Mash and strain through a sieve to make a smooth purée.

title: Creme Brulee

Add vanilla seeds into egg mixture. Boil milk with vanilla pod, simmer on low heat for 5-10 minutes and remove from heat. Cool slightly. Remove vanilla pod and slowly add hot milk into egg mixture. Pour creme  into buttered ramekins and put into a deep baking tray. Pour as much boiling water as to cover ramekins halfway.

title: Baked Rhubarb with Meringue

Spoon into a pastry bag fitted with a star tip. Remove the ramekins from the oven and pipe the meringue on top. Return to the oven and bake for another 10 minutes. Transfer the ramkekins to a plate and serve warm.

title: Mixed Berry and Yogurt Cream Trifle
description: Halve the vanilla bean lengthwise and scrape out the seeds. Combine vanilla seeds with cottage cheese, cream cheese, yogurt, lemon zest and sugar until smooth, adding in a bit of mineral water if needed for desired consistancy.

title: Yogurt Cream with Strawberry Puree
description: Rinse the strawberries. Set 6 aside for garnish. Remove stems from the rest.

title: Strawberries with Cheese Sauce
description: Mash gorgonzola with a fork. Stir in sour cream and yogurt. Place with the strawberries in a bowl and drizzle with port wine. Serve with mint garnish.

title: Cassata
description: Soak the gelatin sheets in cold water. In a bowl, stir the ricotta together with the syrup.

title: Rice Pudding with Red Fruit Jelly
description: Mix the rice together with the milk, cream, the remaining vanilla sugar, lemon zest and salt in an ovenproof pot. Bring to a boil and cook the rice, let soak and cover over low heat for about 10 minutes. Then place rice in the oven covered for 30-40 minutes at 120°C (approximately 250°F). Mix the rice pudding with maple syrup and cinnamon, transfer to plates and add the fruit jelly. Serve warm or cold garnished with mint.

title: Strawberry Mousse
description: Cut the remaining strawberries into slices. Take some lime zest, squeeze the lime and spread the strawberry slices on plates. Drizzle with 2 teaspoons lime juice and garnish with zest. Put strawberry mousse briefly in hot water and place on the strawberries. Garnish with mint leaves.

title: Skewers with Apricot and Grilled Salmon
description: Rinse the apricots, dry, halve and remove pits. Rinse and peel the lemongrass stalks. Pierce 4 apricot halves on one skewer and 1 salmon piece on one skewer. Place the salmon skewers on the charcoal grill or on the electric grill or 2-3 minutes on each side. Brush the apricot skewers with some oil and grill for 6-8 minutes. Add a sweet-spicy chili sauce or grated horseradish on the skewers if desired and serve.

title: Rhubarb and Strawberry Jelly
description: For the sauce, halve vanilla bean lengthwise and scrape out seeds with a sharp knife. Mix the vanilla powder, milk, cream, sugar and vanilla seeds in a pot over low heat and let cool.

description: Peel, quarter and core 2 of the apples. Slice thinly. Toss apples with lemon juice, 1 tablespoon sugar and cinnamon. Let stand.

title: Strawberries with Chocolate

title: Rhubarb Jelly with Berries
description: To serve, cut the rhubarb rod that was set aside with a peeler into thin strips and blanch for about 2 minutes in slightly sweetened water. It should still have a slight bite. Remove and dry with a clean cloth. Place each strip on a plate and form a ring, fill with jelly, garnish with mint and serve.

title: Vanilla Mousse with Mixed Berries
description: Squeeze the gelatin and dissolve in the cream. Allow to cool, stirring constantly. Chill, if necessary. Rinse the berries. Cut the strawberries lengthwise and slice.

title: Orange Coconut Cake
description: Seperate eggs. Beat egg whites until stiff with a pinch of salt. Mix yolks with sugar and water until creamy and white (about 5-7 minutes). Add flour to egg yolk mixture, fold in egg whites and add toasted coconut flakes and orange zest. Line springform pan with baking paper. Add dough, pressing into form. Bake in preheated oven at 180°C (approximately 350°F) for about 30 minutes. Base is done when inserted toothpick comes out clean. Remove from oven, place on a wire rack and cool. Remove from pan, loosening with a knife if necessary, and cut twice, making 3 even horizontal layers.

description: Beat the egg yolks with the sugar until creamy. Gradually stir in the warm milk. Pour everything back into the pot and beat over low heat. Do not boil!

title: Walnut Macaroons

Drain raisins and fold into mixture with bananas. Grease a springform pan measuring 26 cm (approximately 10 inches) in diameter with fat and sprinkle with breadcrumbs. Pour in batter and smooth. Bake in a preheated oven at 180°C (approximately 350°F) for 50 minutes. Cool briefly in pan and then remove. Cool completely on a wire rack. Melt chocolate and drizzle over cake. Top with marzipan potatoes. Let chocolate dry before cutting and serving.

Line a bundt or tube pan with plastic wrap and spread mocha cream into pan. Refrigerate mocha cream until set, about 1 hour. Invert pan to remove mocha cream ring, place on chocolate-coated cake base in springform ring and remove plastic wrap.

title: Berries with Oatmeal Yogurt Ice Cream
description: Heat milk in a small saucepan. Mix egg yolks and sugar in a bowl. Split vanilla bean lengthwise, scrape out the seeds and add to milk. Using an immersion blender, blend until foamy. Set bowl in a hot water bath and gradually add milk, beating mixture until creamy and thick. Place bowl in a cold water bath and allow the cream to cool, stirring occasionally.

title: Rice Pudding with Dried Fruit Compote
description: Grease pudding ramekin with margarine and sprinkle with breadcrumbs. Spread rice mixture in it and place into a pan filled with water (pudding ramekin should be standing in water up to 2/3). Simmer for about 50-60 minutes. Combine dried fruit and their soaking water with remaining sugar, remaining lemon pel and cinnamon. Squeeze lemon juice and add to the mixture, simmer for about 25 minutes. Mix cornstarch with a little water and add to dried fruit mixture to thicken it. Remove pudding from the pan and let rest for about 5 minutes. Invert  onto a plate and drizzle with a little dried fruit compote. Serve accompanied by the rest of dried fruit compote.

title: Nectarine Layer Cake
description: Repeat baking process 7 times to form 8 layers of cake.

title: Small Plum Cakes
description: For the topping: Rinse, halve and pit plums. Melt butter and finely crumble cookies in a freezer bag. Combine butter nad cookies in a bowl and let cool.

title: Blackberry Yogurt Tarts
description: For the topping: Soak gelatin in cold water for 5 minutes. Place, dripping wet, into a small saucepan and dissolve on low heat. Whisk yogurt with sugar and quickly add gelatin, stirring.

title: Currant Meringue Tart
description: Spread dough onto a greased sheet. Rinse currants, set a few aside and remove stems from remaining currants. Spread currants onto dough.

title: Deep-fried Cherries
description: Meanwhile, rinse cherries, pat dry and tie cherries together in bunches of 4 or 5 by the stems with kitchen twine.

title: Creamy Strawberry-Lime Gelatin Bombe
description: Zest and juice 2 limes. Thinly slice remaining lime and set aside. Rinse strawberries, set aside 3-4, core and chop the rest.

title: Orange Salad and Brie with Caramel Vinaigrette
description: In a saucepan, heat sugar until brown and caramelized. Do not allow to scorch. Deglaze pan with vinegar and bring to a boil. Remove from heat and season with a pinch of salt, to taste. Let cool. Whisk walnut oil, vegetable oil and green peppercorns into caramel-vinegar mixture. Drizzle vinaigrette over orange salad. Garnish with walnuts and serve immediately.

title: Chocolate Crepes with Pear Filling
description: For the batter: In a bowl, whisk together  all ingredients except the chocolate, let stand 15 minutes.

title: Crepes with Cherries and Whipped Cream
description: For the dough: Mix all the ingredients together and let rest for 15 minutes.

title: Coconut Crepes with Flambéed Pineapple
description: For the filling, mix crème fraîche with the vanilla sugar, lime zest and juice. Refrigerate. Cut pineapple rings into chunks and drain on paper towels.

title: Plum and Elderberry Compote
description: Add the water and honey to the pot. In a cup, stir the potato flour with the cold water until smooth.

title: Rhubarb and Semolina Gratin with Strawberry Sauce
description: Over high heat, boil down the rhubarb cooking liquid for 3-4 minutes. Pour in the milk and bring to a boil. Sprinkle in the semolina and simmer while stirring for 2-3 minutes. Remove from the heat and stir in the mascarpone. Separate the egg. Beat egg white until stiff. Stir the egg yolk into the semolina mixture. Fold the lemon zest into the egg whites. Pour over the rhubarb and bake in a preheated oven at 200°C (approximately 400°F) (gas mark 3, convection 180°C or approximately 350°F) for about 10 minutes.

title: Peanut Cookies
description: Remove from refrigerator and use 2 spoons to place heaps of the dough on a parchment paper-lined baking sheet. Sprinkle with remaining peanutes. Bake in a preheated oven at 175°C (fan: 160°C, gas mark: 2) (approximately 350°F) for 15 minutes. Cool on a wire rack.

title: Apple-potato Pancake Casserole
description: Cut potato pancakes into pieces and place in a greased shallow baking dish or 4 souffle dishes. Toss apples, almonds and raisins and place in the baking dish.

title: Orange Oatmeal Bars
description: For the frosting: Peel the oranges with a sharp knife so that all white skin is removed. Cut the oranges in half and the into slices. Collect the juice. Cover the dough with orange slices and bake at 175°C (approximately 350°F) (gas mark 2) for about 35 minutes.

title: Almond Mousse
description: Whisk the egg yolks, sugar and Amaretto until creamy. Fold in the melted chocolate. Squeeze out the excess water from the gelatin and melt over low heat with 2-3 tablespoons cream. Fold into the chocolate mixture followed by the ground almonds. Chill until the mixture starts to set. Whip the cream until stiff then fold in. Chill for 2 hours.
types: ['Dessert', 'with Alcohol', 'Juice', 'Fruit Juice', 'Eggs', 'Spices', 'Dairy', 'Nut', 'Fruit', 'Course', 'Lunch', 'Dinner', 'Menu', 'Mousse', 'Buffet', 'German', 'date night', 'Meal for Four', 'Guest', 'Birthday', 'Party', 'Sweet', 'Sunday cooking', 'weekend cooking']

title: Ricotta with Walnut Honey
description: Chop the walnuts coarsely. Melt the butter in a frying pan and toast the walnuts until fragrant and golden brown. Mix with the honey. Unwrap the ricotta and serve with the walnut honey.

title: Mascarpone Cream with Berries
description: Rinse the berries and pat dry. Layer the mascarpone cream, berries and cookies in serving glasses. Serve immediately.

title: White Wine Sabayon with Fresh Berries
description: Whisk the eggs, sugar and white wine in a metal bowl until combined. Set over a hot water bath and whisk until light and foamy.

title: Strawberries in Batter
description: Heat the oil to 175ºC (approximately 350ºF).

title: Plum Compote with Semolina Dumplings
description: For the semolina dumplings: Bring the milk, butter and salt to a boil. Whisk in the semolina, add the sugar and stir until the mixture forms a single thick mass. Remove the pot from the heat and immediately stir in the egg. Shape into quenelles with 2 small spoons and poach in gently boiling water for about 5 minutes, or until they rise to the surface. Use a slotted spoon to transfer the dumplings to paper towels to drain.

title: Strawberry Cream Mousse with Meringue
description: For the mousse: Bloom the gelatin in cold water. Rinse the strawberries and pat dry. Set some aside for garnish then hull and purée the rest. Transfer 4 tablespoons strawberry purée to a small saucepan. Squeeze out the excess water from 3 sheets of gelatin and gently melt in the purée. Stir into the remaining strawberry purée and chill briefly.

title: Chocolate Bananas in Coconut
description: Break the chocolate into pieces and place in a bowl. Melt in a bowl over a pan of hot water, stirring occasionally.

title: Sea Buckthorn-honey Yoghurt
description: Mix egg yolk, honey, vanilla and sea buckthorn juice in a bowl. Stir in yogurt. Squeeze gelatin and dissolve in the lime juice in a pot over very low heat.

title: Red Fruit Compote
description: Boil juice and pour in the prepared fruit. Cook about 5 minutes on low heat.

title: Berry Gratin
description: Beat the egg white. Stir in the sugar and vanilla sugar.

title: Cheese Herb Pastry
description: For the filling: Mix the ricotta with the eggs, whipped cream, grated cheese, and herbs. Season with salt and pepper.

title: Cinnamon Parfait with Dumplings
description: For the sauce: Rinse plum, remove seeds and boil with sugar until very soft. Strain through a sieve and add a bit of water. Let cool.
types: ['Cooking', 'Bread', 'Summer', 'Autumn', 'What to Cook on the Weekend?', 'German', 'Family', 'Meal for Four', 'Guest', 'Sweet', 'Sunday cooking', 'weekend cooking', 'with Alcohol', 'Milk', 'Eggs', 'Spices', 'Dairy', 'Fruit', 'Course', 'Lunch', 'Dinner', 'Dessert']

title: Semolina Soufflé with Ice Cream Made with Sugar Beet Syrup
description: For the semolina soufflé, bring the milk to a boil in a pot along with half of the sugar and the salt. Slit the vanilla pod and add to the mixture. Sprinkle in the semolina flour and simmer for a few minutes while stirring. Remove from the heat and remove the vanilla pod. Separate the eggs. Mix the butter and egg yolks with the semolina. Beat the egg whites, then gradually sprinkle in the remaining sugar. Gently fold everything together.

title: White Chocolate Mousse with Orange Noodles and Wine Sauce
description: For the noodles, mix flour, oil, egg, sugar, salt and orange zest to a smooth dough. Wrap dough in plastic wrap and refrigerate for about 30 minutes. Knead dough and roll out thinly on a floured surface. Loosely roll up dough sheet and cut into strips. Pull noodles apart and let dry. Boil noodles in plenty of lightly sugared water until al dente. Drain noodles, rinse with cold water, drain well and spread on a baking sheet. For the syrup, mix orange juice and Cointreau over high heat and boil down until thickened. Mix noodles into syrup just before serving.

title: Almond Bundt Cake
description: Mix the flour with baking powder and ground almonds. Stir half of the flour mixture into the egg mixture, and stir in the remaining flour mixture. Stir in the rum and some milk until a smooth, thick batter is formed. Stir in the chocolate covered espresso beans.

title: Sweet Cherry Muesli
description: Arrange the fruit and oatmeal in a serving bowl.

title: Crêpes with Summer Fruit
description: Rinse the strawberries, currants and cherries and pat dry. Cut the strawberries into quarters and pit the cherries. Toss the fruit with the remaining honey, cinnamon and sesame seeds.

title: Melon Smoothie with Strawberries
description: Squeeze the juice from the lime. Reserve some strawberries for garnish. Coarsely chop the remaining strawberries in a blender then stir in the lime juice and agave nectar.
types: ['Cocktail', 'Low-fat', 'low-fat vegan', 'Low-cholesterol', 'Low-protein', 'Gluten-free Beverage', 'Lactose-free Beverage', 'non-alcoholic', 'Milk-free', 'Vegan', 'Summer', 'Guest', 'Party', 'Beverage', 'non-alcoholic', 'Shake', 'Strawberry shake', 'Smoothie', 'Strawberry smoothie', 'Fruit Smoothie', 'Fruit', 'Dessert', 'easy dessert', 'Fruit Dessert']

title: Kefir Pannacotta with Cherry and Redcurrant Compote
description: Heat 2-3 tablespoons kefir over a hot water bath. Add the gelatin and stir until melted. Stir into the remaining kefir.

title: Fried Cinnamon Cakes
description: Roll the dough on a floured surface into a log (about 4 cm in diameter) (approximately 1½ inches in diameter) and cut into 25 slices. Roll out each dough slice on a floured surface to a very thin cake.
types: ['Dessert', 'High-fiber Dessert', 'High-protein Dessert', 'meat-free', 'Boneless', 'Milk-free', 'Grandma's', 'European', 'German', 'Spring', 'Summer', 'Autumn', 'Autumn snack', 'winter', 'Easter', 'Christmas', 'Christmas pastry', 'Rustic', 'German', 'Easy', 'everyday meal', 'crowdpleaser', 'Guest', 'Birthday', 'Home Cooking', 'Winter cabin', 'birthday for kids', 'Children's Party', 'Snack for Kids', 'Classic', 'Party', 'Sweet', 'cooking for one', 'Sunday cooking', 'College Cooking', 'weekend cooking', 'Cooking', 'Pancake', 'Course', 'Snack', 'Menu']

title: Lemon and Mandarin Tiramisu
description: Juice remaining lemon and mix with vanilla sugar and rum. Briefly soak ladyfingers in lemon juice mixture. To assemble tiramisu, layer ladyfingers, quark mixture and mandarins into a shallow baking dish, finishing with mandarins on top. Refrigerate tiramisu for 2-3 hours. Garnish tiramisu with mint leaves as desired to serve.

title: Raspberry Ladyfinger Torte
description: For the ladyfingers, line a baking sheet with parchment paper. Beat eggs, sugar and salt with an electric hand mixer until creamy, about 10 minutes. Sift flour over egg mixture and gently fold in with a whisk. Transfer batter to a pastry bag with a round tip and pipe batter in strips about 5 cm long (approximately 2 inches long) onto prepared baking sheet. Bake ladyfingers in oven preheated to 190°C (gas mark 4)(approximately 375°F) for about 8 minutes.

title: Chocolate Kumquats
description: Cut the chocolate into pieces and place in a bowl. Melt over a hot water bath. Add the pistachios, coconut and sprinkles to separate small bowls.

title: Spanish Brandy Torte with Apricots
description: For the cream, soak the gelatin in cold water. Whip the cream until almost stiff, gradually adding the vanilla sugar. Dissolve gelatin according to package directions. Stir in brandy and powdered sugar. Fold in the whipped cream. Place ladyfingers in a shallow dish and soak with peach liqueur. Drain the apricots, reserving a few for garnish. Place the crust in a cake ring.

title: Sweet Stuffed Tomatoes with Vanilla Ice Cream
description: Cut the apple and pear into quarters, remove the seeds, peel and finely chop. Mix the orange peel, raisins, amaretto cookies, apple, pear, ½ teaspoon cinnamon and lemon juice. Carefully fill the tomatoes and drizzle with honey. Place the lid on top and place a piece of vanilla bean in the center. Pour the melted butter into an ovenproof dish and place the tomatoes in the dish. Bake in a preheated oven at 180°C (approximately 350°F) (gas mark 2-3, fan: 160°C or 325°F) and cook for about 10 minutes. Arrange 2 tomatoes on each plate, sprinkle with powdered sugar and cinnamon. Serve with vanilla ice cream.

title: Cheesecake with Caramel
description: Pour the legumes on top of the parchment paper and bake the crust onthe bottom rack of a preheated oven at 200°C (approximately 400°F) for about 10 minutes. Remove the legumes and baking paper, then let cool slightly. For the filling, melt the butter and allow to cool. Separate the eggs. Mix the quark, sugar, salt, egg yolks, cheesecake helper and lemon juice. Beat the egg whites until stiff and fold into the quark mixture, then spread over the crust. Place the sugar and water in a small pan and caramelize until golden brown. Drizzle on the filling. Bake in a preheated oven at 180°C (approximately 350°F) for about 1 hour. Let cool and serve sprinkled with sugar.

title: Moroccan Oranges
description: Peel oranges carefully, removing as much pith as possible. Slice crosswise into about 1/2 cm (approximately 1/5 inch) slices. Combine sugar with cane sugar syrup, honey and 200 ml (approximately 3/4 cup) of water and bring to a boil. Add zest and simmer for about 5 minutes on medium heat.

title: Pumpkin Pudding
description: Squeeze the excess water from the gelatin and stir into the hot pumpkin puree until dissolved. Stir the egg yolk mixture into the pumpkin puree, transfer the mixture to a medium-sized bowl and refrigerate for 3-4 hours.

title: Mousse with Berries
description: Soak the gelatin in cold water to soften, about 10 minutes, then dissolve in a small saucepan over low heat and add quickly into the milk mixture. Beat the cream until stiff peaks forms and fold gently into milk mixture.

title: Chocolate Souffle
description: Sprinkle with powdered sugar and serve.

title: Apple Fritters with Vanilla Sauce
description: Whisk egg yolks with sugar in a bowl until creamy. Slowly add warm cream milk, return to pot and simmer on low heat until thickens, stirring. Remove vanilla pod.

title: Rice Pudding
description: Finely chop pistachios and set aside 1 tablespoon for garnish. Stir remaining pistachios, raisins and rose water into rice pudding. Cover rice pudding and refrigerate for 2-3 hours.

title: Raspberry Ice Cream Souffle
description: Soak the gelatin in cold water.

title: Pineapple Sorbet
description: Peel the pineapple, core and chop the flesh coarsely. Purée until smooth then measure out 500 ml (approximately 2 cups). Mix the pineapple purée with the wine syrup. Transfer to a shallow container and freeze, stirring occasionally, for 4-5 hours.

title: Berry, Pistachio and Vanilla Ice Cream Parfaits
description: Whip the cream until stiff and fold into the berry cream. Distribute 1/2 of the cream among 4 serving glasses then top each with 1 scoop of ice cream. Top with the remaining cream and sprinkle with the chopped pistachios. Garnish with currants, if desired. Serve immediately.

title: Sweet Custard Cake
description: Combine the remaining flour, remaining sugar and salt. Whisk the eggs and butter into the yeast mixture, add to the dry ingredients and knead with the dough hook attachment until smooth. Cover and let rise in a warm place for about 1 hour.

title: Apricot Semolina Cake
description: Beat the butter until creamy. Add the sugar, lemon zest and eggs and beat until the sugar has dissolved. Stir in the flour, semolina and baking powder. If necessary, add milk.
types: ['Cake', 'Baking', 'cake or tart with fruit', 'Dessert', 'crowdpleaser', 'Guest', 'Birthday', 'birthday for kids', 'Country Style', 'Sunday cooking']

title: Honey Cake Parfait Slices
description: For the sauce, stir orange juice into lingonberries in a saucepan and bring to a boil. Mix cornstarch with a little cold water and stir into lingonberries to thicken. Stir remaining rum into lingonberry mixture, let cool and drizzle onto serving plates. Cut parfait into slices, serve on prepared plates and sprinkle with honey cake crumbs.

title: Doughnut Wreaths
description: Carefully loosen the doughnuts from the pan.

title: Snowman Cake
description: For the filling: Soak gelatine. Beat egg yolks and sugar until fluffy, then stir in rum. Beat butter until creamy, then fold in yolks. Dissolve gelatin in some butter mixture, then stir into remaining butter mixture. Beat cream until stiff, remove about 3 tablespoons and set aside. Fold remaining cream into butter mixture.

title: Cherry Snail Cake
description: Let the cake cool for 10 minutes in the pan. Loosen the cake from the pan turn out onto cake rack lined with parchment paper. Pulling on the paper, turn the cake and cut in a spiral pattern. Push the cake apart slightly to cool. Combine 75ml (approximately 1/3 cup) of milk with the pudding powder. Boil the remaining milk with the sugar. Stir in the pudding mixture and bring to a boil again. Pour into a bowl, cover with plastic wrap and leave to cool.

title: Sherry Torte with Fruit
description: Line the bottom of two springform pans (28 and 18 cm diameter) (approximately 11 and 7 inches) with parchment paper. Spread the batter in the two baking pans, smooth the surface and bake in a preheated convection oven at 170°C (approximately 325°F) for 30-45 minutes. Loosen from the pans, and turn out onto a wire rack covered with parchment paper. Remove the baking paper from the bottom of the cakes and leave to cool fully. Cut each cake twice horizontally to form 3 layers.

title: Dried Spiced Meringues
description: Sprinkle the pistachios over 1/2 of the mounds and the pine nuts over the other 1/2. Bake in a preheated oven at 150°C (approximately 300°F) for about 45 minutes.

title: Crème Fraîche Cashew Cookies
description: Roll the dough out on a floured surface to about 2-3 mm (approximately 1/10 inch) thick. Cut the dough into cookies using a scalloped cookie cutter about 4 cm (approximately 1 1/2 inch) in diameter and place on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.

title: Chocolate Morsels
description: For the topping: Cut the chocolate into pieces, place in a bowl and melt over a hot water bath, stirring occasionally. Spread the melted chocolate evenly over the cake. Draw wavy lines through the chocolate using a pie comb. Let chocolate harden. Make powdered sugar stars using an icing stencil over the chocolate topping. Cut into small pieces and serve.

title: Cherry Puddings with Custard
description: Rinse cherries and remove stems and pits. Beat butter until creamy, add egg yolks and sugar and mix well. Mix soaked bread, almonds, cinnamon and lemon zest into butter mixture. Mix cherries and cherry brandy and fold into pudding mixture. Beat egg whites with 1 pinch sugar until stiff and fold into pudding mixture.

title: Baumkuchen with Apricot Jam and White Chocolate
description: Line a baking sheet with parchment paper then arrange a 25 x 27 cm (approximately 9 x 11 inch) baking frame over the baking sheet. Pour 2 tablespoons batter into the frame, spread out thinly with an offset palette knife and then broil for 2 minutes, until golden brown. Spread another 2 tablespoons batter over top and broil for 2 minutes. Repeat with the remaining batter then let cool.

title: Almond and Chocolate Pralines
description: Meanwhile, for the almond mixture: Toast the almonds in a dry frying pan then let cool. Chop the chocolate into pieces and melt over a hot water bath. Stir in the almonds then use 2 spoons to form 3 cm (approximately 1-inch) discs on a piece of aluminum foil. Let set.

title: Chocolate Chip Cookies
description: Use teaspoons to heap portions of the dough onto a lined baking sheet. Bake for about 15-20 minutes at 180°C (approximately 350°F). Remove from the oven, let cool and serve.

title: Chocolate Buttercream Rolls
description: Mix the melted chocolate into the reserved batter, transfer to a piping bag fitted with a small plain tip and pipe over the batter in thin evenly spaced lines. Bake in a preheated oven at 200°C (approximately 400°F) for about 12 minutes.

title: Elisen Gingerbread
description: Whip the egg whites until stiff, sprinkling in the remaining sugar. Fold into the egg yolk mixture, spread over the wafers and smooth the surface with a wet knife.

title: Fig and Pear Napoleons
description: Prick the dough several times with a fork and bake in a preheated oven (200°C) (approximately 400°F) until golden brown, about 12 minutes. Let cool then cut into 12 (6 cm diameter) (approximately 2-inch) circles.
types: ['Dessert', 'Baking', 'Dough', 'Puff Pastry', 'Spices', 'Herb', 'Dairy', 'Fruit', 'Course', 'Lunch', 'Dinner', 'Menu', 'Fruit Dessert', 'German', 'Exotic', 'festively', 'Meal for Four', 'Garden Party', 'Guest', 'Birthday', 'Party', 'Sweet', 'Sunday cooking', 'weekend cooking']

title: Powdered Donuts with Pomegranate Syrup
description: In a small bowl, mix cornstarch and 2 tablespoons cold water, then whisk into boiling liquid and bring to a boil again. Halve pomegranate and remove seeds. Stir seeds into sauce. Season with a dash of cinnamon.

title: Poppy Seed Cream Torte
description: For the filling, mix the raisins and rum and set aside to soak. Soak gelatin in cold water for 5 minutes. Mix pudding mix with 5 to 6 tablespoons milk in a pan. Stir in remaining milk and sugar. Bring to a boil. Remove from the heat. Stir a little of the hot pudding into the egg yolks. Stir egg yolk mixture into pudding in the pan. Squeeze out the gelatin and dissolve in the hot pudding. Cover with plastic wrap and set aside to cool. Stir in yogurt and raisins. Cut cake crosswise into 2 even layers. Place bottom cake layer on a plate and place a cake ring around it. Spread with the pudding mixture and top with the remaining cake layer. Refrigerate for 2 to 3 hours.

title: Checkerboard Christmas Cake
description: For the sponge cake: Reduce the oven to 180°C (350°F). Whisk the eggs until foamy then gradually stir in the sugar, vanilla sugar, bitter almond oil and cinnamon until thick and creamy. Fold in the cornstarch, baking powder and ground hazelnuts. Line the springform pan with parchment paper, fill with the batter and bake for about 30 minutes. Let cool in the pan for 10 minutes then invert onto a wire rack to cool completely.

title: Chocolate and Cranberry Cakes
description: Line a baking sheet with parchment paper and place a 28 x 30 cm (approximately 11 x 12 inch) cake frame on top. Fill with the batter and bake in a preheated oven at 180°C (approximately 350°F) for 25-30 minutes. Run a knife along the inside edges of the cake frame and remove. Let the cake cool.

title: Christmas Tree Cake
description: Beat butter until creamy. Gradually beat in sugar, vanilla, salt, gingerbread spice, eggs and chocolate. Combine flour, cocoa and baking powder, then fold into butter mixture.

title: White and Green Layer Cake with Chocolate Stars
description: For the topping and for decorating, coarsely chop bittersweet chocolate and melt in a double boiler. Remove from heat and allow to cool slightly. Fill a small freezer bag with chocolate and cut off a tiny corner. Pipe chocolate hearts onto a large sheet of parchment paper. Set aside and let chocolate cool and dry completely.

title: French Crullers
description: Put dough into a bowl, then stir in 1 egg. Let dough cool slightly, then stir in remaining eggs.

title: Poppy Dumplings with Plums
description: For the filling, heat milk with vanilla sugar. Add poppy seeds and cook for 1 to 2 minutes, stirring constantly. Stir in plum butter and powdered sugar. Stir in rum.

title: Sweet Strawberry Waffles
description: For the waffles: melt butter for the waffle. Mix egg and 30 g (approximately 1/4 cup) powdered sugar with a hand mixer for about 8 minutes or until very creamy. Gradually stir in the flour. Then mix in butter, sour cream and orange zest. Let rest 15 minutes. In a hot waffle iron over medium heat, cook waffles until golden brown.

title: Whipped Cream
description: Add sugar. Whisk in cornstarch and remaining cream. Stir and bring to a boil again. Add orange liqueur.

title: Savory Bacon, Onion and Pea Muffins
description: Stir the flour and baking powder into the quark mixture and mix until smooth. Fold in the bacon and onions, sliced chives and peas.

title: Gingerbread Mousse
description: Combine milk, cocoa, honey and gingerbread spice over low heat. Dissolve gelatine into milk mixture and chill. Beat cream with vanilla sugar until stiff and fold into milk mixture when it begins to gel.

title: Sherry Cinnamon Puff Pastry
description: Bake in preheated oven at 220°C (gas mark 4-5, fan: 200 degrees) (approximately 425°F) for about 15 minutes. Let cool on a wire rack.

title: Cream Cheesecake with Figs
description: For the topping: Soak gelatine for 5 minutes in cold water. Whisk quark with powdered sugar. Heat 2-3 tablespoons of grape juice and dissolve gelatin in it, whisking. Add remaining juice and mix well. Combine juice mixture with quark and refrigerate until mixture starts to gel. Beat cream until stiff and fold into the mixture. Drain figs and cut into pieces, fold into the cream. Spread cream onto cake and refrigerate for 3 hours.

title: Orange Rum Cake with Fresh Fruit
description: For the topping, heat orange juice, sugar and vanilla sugar in a pan and simmer 3-5 minutes, then remove from heat and stir in rum. Remove cake from pan. Pour half of orange juice mixture into pan and return cake to pan. Sprinkle cake with remaining orange juice mixture. Set aside and soak until liquid is absorbed, about 30 minutes.

title: Raspberry Mousse Pastry
description: Pour the batter into a piping bag with a large fluted tip. Pipe out about 1/2 of the dough into a narrow rectangle (about 14 x 25 cm) (approximately 6 x 10 inches) onto a lined baking sheet. Bake in preheated oven at 200°C (approximately 400°F) (gas mark 3-4, fan: 180°C or approximately 350°F) for 25-30 minutes. Pipe the rest of the dough onto a second lined baking sheet in a lattice pattern of the same size. Bake for 25-30 minutes. Let both layers cool on a wire rack.

title: Biscuit Roll with Berry Yogurt Filling
description: For the filling: Soak gelatine in cold water for 5 minutes. Clean  raspberries, puree 200 grams (approximately 7 ounces) and strain through a sieve. Stir in powdered sugar and vanilla. Heat lemon juice and dissolve gelatine in it, combine with raspberry puree. Refrigerate until mixture starts to gel.

title: Braided Nut Bread
description: Chop walnuts. Mince apricots.

title: Yogurt-lemon Cake
description: For the garnish, rinse lemon in hot water, cut into thin slices and halve or quarter the slices. Melt the couverture and dip lemon slices in the melted couverture. Allow to dry. Pour remaining couverture on a plate, spread out thinly and allow to set. Scrape with a spatula into chocolate curls. Distribute lemon slices and chocolate curls on the cake.

title: Raspberry Cream Cheese Torte
description: Let the cake cool on a wire rack.

title: Spicy Fruit Salad
description: Mix all the fruit together in a bowl.

title: Pistachio Pudding with Oranges and Marinated Dates
description: Whip the cream. Once juice filling begins to set, fold in whipped cream, quark and 1 tablespoon ground pistachios. Pour into small dessert dishes and chill overnight.

title: Almond Meringue Cherry Cake
description: Remove and let cool for 10 minutes, then release from pan and let cool on a wire rack.

title: Apricot Doughnut Holes
description: Knead again and thinly roll out dough on a floured surface. Add mounds of jam onto half of the dough, then cover with remaining dough and press well between mounds. Cut out mounds and shape into a ball. Place dough on parchment paper and let rise for 15 minutes.

title: Raspberry Cream Cake

Roll about 2/3 of dough on a floured surface into a round large enough to line bottom of the pan. Place dough in the pan. Roll the remaining dough into a thin 5 cm (approximately 5-inch) wide strip. Place strip in the pan around the sides, pressing where the bottom and sides meet. Prick the dough several times with a fork. Refrigerate 1 to 2 hours.

Roll out the dough on a floured surface to a circle large enoughto line the bottom of a 26 cm (approximately 10-inch) diameter springform pan. Place the dough in the pan and prick several times with a fork.  Bake in preheated 225°C (approximately 425°F) oven for 12 to 15 minutes. Cool.

title: Semolina Pudding
description: Pour the elderberry juice, apple juice, lemon peel, cinnamon stick, star anise and brown sugar into a saucepan and bring to a boil.

description: Combine 8 tablespoons of milk, cornstarch and egg yolks. Combine remaining milk and espresso. Slit vanilla bean cut and scrape out seeds. Add vanilla pod and boil with milk with cornstarch. Slowly bring milk mixture to a boil. Remove vanilla pod. Add espresso milk. description: For the gratin: Rinse peaches. Combine white wine, sugar, cinnamon, star anise and slit vanilla pod in a large pot and bring to a boil. Add peaches and simmer for about 6-8 minutes or until peaches become soft. Remove peaches with a slotted spoon.

title: Cherry Chestnut Dumplings
description: Mince cherries and combine with chestnut puree. Shape into balls.

description: Whip the cream with the sugar and stabilizer and fold in the lemon balm. Place one of the baked layers on a cake plate and place a cake ring around the outside. Spread half of the mascarpone cream on it. Place the 2nd layer on top and spread the remaining cream on it. Set the 3rd layer on top and garnish with remaining pineapple and lemon balm. Remove the cake ring and serve.

title: Strawberry Gazpacho with Pancake Strips
description: Rinse, trim and chop the strawberries. Arrange the strawberries on four plates, and divide the cold gazpacho equally into each plate.

title: MIni Bundt Cake with Frozen Parfait and Wine Sauce
description: Grease wells of mini bundt pan with butter and coat with sesame seeds. Fill wells of pan with batter. Bake in preheated oven at 200°C (fan: 180°C, gas mark 3-4) (approximately 400°F), 45-50 minutes. Cool cakes for 10 minutes in pan, then remove from pan and cool on a wire rack.

title: Pastry Cream Torte with Streusel
description: For the streusel, mix flour, sugar, vanilla sugar, cinnamon and margarine until crumbly and spread evenly over pastry circles. Bake pastry circles in springform pan in oven preheated to 200°C (gas mark 3)(approximately 400°F) for about 15 minutes. Cut one pastry circle into 12 pieces while still hot. Let remaining three pastry circles cool on a wire rack.

description: Bake the cream puffs in the oven on the middle rack for 15-20 minutes. Remove, cut in half horizontally and leave to cool on a wire rack. For the chocolate and pineapple filling, drain the pineapple slices well, saving the juice. Cut in half. Beat the pudding powder with the pineapple juice and cream according to package instructions. Spread the pudding on the cream puff bottoms and garnish with pineapple. Replace the tops of the puffs. Chop the chocolate, melt over a hot water bath, pour into a freezer bag and snip a small hole in the tip. Decorate the pastries with the chocolate, allow to dry, then serve.

description: Line a rectangular baking pan with parchment paper. Pour in the batter and smooth the top. Bake in preheated 180°C (approximately 350°F) oven for 12 to 15 minutes. Cool on a wire rack.

title: Chocolate Cake with Almonds
description: Whip the butter and sugar until light and frothy. Separate the eggs. Gradually stir in the egg yolks then mix in the ground almonds, flour, chocolate, lemon zest and vanilla. Whisk until combined. Whip the egg whites until stiff and fold in.

title: Quick Chocolate Mousse
description: Let the mousse cool slightly then chill for about 2 hours in the refrigerator.

title: Sailor's Knot Fritters
description: Turn the dough out onto a lightly floured work surface and roll out thinly. Cut into 1 x 35 cm (approximately 1/3 x 14 inch) strips then tie each strip into a double knot. Heat the oil to 325-350°F. Working in batches, fry the knots until golden brown. Remove from the oil with a slotted spoon, place on paper towels to drain and immediately sprinkle with cinnamon sugar.

title: Blueberry Cake
description: Rinse the blueberries and pat dry. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper, fill with the batter, smooth the surface, sprinkle with blueberries and bake in a preheated oven at 175°C (approximately 350°F) for about 40 minutes.

title: Puff Pastry Tart with Fruit and Whipped Cream
description: For the topping: Drain the apricots and collect the juice. Mix the juice with 250 ml (approximately 1 cup) water. Rinse the raspberries and pat dry. Whip the cream, vanilla and whipped cream stabilizer until stiff.

title: Cinnamon Sugar Apple Fritters
description: Peel the apples, remove the cores and cut into 1 cm (approximately 3/8 inch) thick slices. Mix 2 tablespoons of sugar with the grated lemon zest in a shallow dish.

title: Buttermilk Pancakes with Blueberry Compote and Vanilla Ice Cream
description: For the pancakes: Combine the flour, salt, sugar, vanilla sugar and baking powder. Whisk the egg, buttermilk and sparkling water until smooth then whisk into the dry ingredients until smooth. Working in batches, melt the butter in a large frying pan, add tablespoonfuls of batter to the pan and cook until golden brown on both sides. Drain on paper towels.

title: Crêpes with Cherries and Vanilla Custard
description: For the custard: Prepare the pudding powder according to package directions with the milk and sugar. Stir in the yogurt and let cool.

title: Lemon Parfait with Fruit
description: Mix egg yolks in a bowl with hot lemon syrup while stirring constantly until a creamy mixture is formed. Stir egg yolk mixture over a cold water bath until chilled. Whip cream in a bowl until stiff, add chopped lemon balm and mix. Fold whipped cream into egg yolk mixture. Pour lemon mixture into a narrow pan and freeze for 4-5 hours.

title: Crème Fraîche Tart
description: Grease a 26 cm (approximately 10-inch) fluted tart pan with removable bottom. Roll out the dough on a lightly floured work surface and use to line the prepared pan. Prick the base several times with a fork, line with parchment paper and fill with dried beans. Blind bake in a preheated oven at 200°C (approximately 400°F) for 15 minutes. Remove the baking beans and parchment paper. Reduce the heat to 175°C (approximately 350°F).

title: Cinnamon Olive Oil Cake
description: Line the base of a 28 cm (approximately 11-inch) springform pan with parchment paper, fill with the batter and bake in a preheated oven at 180°C (approximately 350°F) for 45-60 minutes. Let the cake cool in the pan for 10 minutes then invert onto a wire rack lined with parchment paper and let cool completely.

title: Crispy Lemon Waffles
description: For the waffles: Whisk the melted butter, sugar, eggs, flour, rum, vanilla sugar, baking powder, finely grated lemon zest and water until smooth.

title: Almond Pudding with Brandy Sauce
description: Mix the lukewarm milk with the cocoa powder, coffee powder, cinnamon, vanilla bean seeds, salt and 50 grams sugar. Melt the butter in a large frying pan and cook the flour until light golden brown and nutty. Gradually mix in the milk, stirring constantly, and bring to a boil. Transfer to a bowl.

title: Fruit and Nut Bundt Spice Cake
description: Mix butter, sugar, cinnamon, cloves, ginger, coriander, anise, bourbon-vanilla sugar, salt and lemon and orange zest and juice. Add eggs one at a time to butter mixture, stirring at least 2 minutes after each addition. Mix flour, baking powder and cornstarch, sift over batter, fold in with a whisk and stir briefly. Fold nut mixture into batter.

title: Apple Lgratin
description: Butter tart pan (28 cm in diameter) (approximately 12 inches) and spread with apple wedges, overlapping.

title: Cheesecake with Oranges
description: For the topping: Peel oranges and cut into slices.

title: Campari Torte with Pomegranate Seeds
description: For the Campari gelatin, soak the red gelatin in cold water. Heat the orange juice and sugar in a small saucepan. Remove from the heat, stir in the Campari and melt the gelatin in the liquid. Pour into a flat, rectangular dish lined with plastic wrap, cover and refrigerate.

title: Cinnamon Puff Crescents
description: For the cream, soak the gelatin in cold water. Boil the poppy seeds with the milk, sugar and lemon zest. Allow to swell for 10 minutes. Squeeze out the gelatine and add to the poppy mixture. Stir until the gelatin is dissolved. Allow to cool slightly, then stir in the quark, mascarpone and lemon juice.

title: Gingerbread Soufflé
description: For the souffle: Cut chocolate into pieces and melt over hot water bath. Separate eggs. Beat egg whites until stiff. Whisk egg yolks with sugar, vanilla sugar, gingerbread spices and orange liqueur for at least 8 minutes. Add chocolate and stir well.

title: Individual Rice Puddings with Strawberry-Rhubarb Compote
description: For the strawberry-rhubarb compote: Rinse the rhubarb and cut into bite-sized pieces. Rinse and halve the strawberries. Bring the currant jelly and water to a boil in a saucepan. Add the rhubarb and strawberries and simmer for 5-6 minutes. Remove from heat and let cool.

title: Crêpes with Mixed Berries
description: Trim berries and soak. Cut strawberries smaller as needed. Boil currant juice. Stir cornstarch with a little cold water and add to juice. Stir and bring to a boil again. Stir in berries and vanilla. Cool.

title: Apple Sorbet
description: For garnish, rinse 2 apples, halve, remove seeds and cut into thin slices. Poach in half of the syrup for 2-3 minutes. Let cool in the syrup. Remove the apple slices gently, lay on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper and allow to dry at 50°C (approximately 120°F) in a preheated oven. Then let cool.

title: Rice Pudding with Caramel Sauce and Fruit Salad
description: Beat the whipping cream until stiff. Remove the vanilla bean pod from the rice and fold in the whipped cream.

title: Poached Pears with Gorgonzola White Wine
description: For the garnish, toast pine nuts in a dry skillet and then put on a plate. Rinse frisée, trim and spin dry. Cut Gorgonzola in pieces.

title: Puff Pastry with Custard Filling and Apricots
description: Soak the gelatin in cold water for 5 minutes. Mix the pudding powder with 4-5 tablespoons milk. Bring the remaining milk to a boil with the sugar. Stir in the pudding and bring to a boil again. Pour the pudding mixture into a bowl. Squeeze out the gelatine, then stir it into the hot pudding to dissolve. Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and leave to cool.

title: Layered Berry Cream Torte
description: For the berry cream, soak gelatin in plenty of cold water for about 5 minutes. Rinse raspberries and blueberries, puree and strain through a sieve. Mix quark, powdered sugar and lemon zest. Heat 6 tablespoons cream. Squeeze gelatin and stir into heated cream until dissolved. Stir 1-2 tablespoons quark mixture into gelatin mixture to temper. Stir gelatin mixture into quark mixture with the pureed berries. Refrigerate berry cream until partially set.

title: Caramel Torte
description: For the cream, soak gelatin sheets in a bowl of cold water until softened, about 10 minutes. Stir together the pudding powder with 10 tablespoons milk. Boil remaining milk with sugar. Stir the pudding mix into the milk and sugar mixture in the saucepan and bring to a boil. Squeeze excess water from the gelatin and stir into the custard mixture. Cool the custard mixture over an ice water bath while vigorously stirring. Whip the cream and fold into the custard mixture. Transfer 3 tablespoons of the cream to a piping bag fitted with a star tip and carefully fill the pastry balls.

title: Coconut Strawberry Torte
description: For the cake, beat eggs and sugar foamy. Mix flour and baking powder, sift over batter and fold in. Line the bottom of a 26 cm (approximately 10-inch) diameter springform pan with parchment paper. Pour in the batter and smooth the top. Bake in preheated 180°C (approximately 350°F) oven for 20 minutes. Remove cake from the pan, invert onto a wire rack, remove the parchment paper and cool the cake. Cut the cake crosswise into 2 even layers. For the coconut cream, bring coconut and milk to a boil. Allow to cool. Stir in vanilla sugar and coconut liqueur. Soak and dissolve the gelatin according to package instructions. Mix with the coconut mixture. Beat the cream until stiff and fold into the coconut mixture. Place the crust on a plate with a cake ring around it. Brush with strawberry jam and top with a cake layer, cut side up.

title: Florentine Cookies with Chocolate
description: Roll out the dough to 2-3 mm thick on a lightly floured surface and cut out round cookies (about 5-6 cm in diameter) (approximately 2 inches in diameter). Place the cookies on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper and bake in a preheated oven at 200°C (fan: 180°C, gas mark 3) (approximately 400°F) for about 15 minutes.

title: Chocolate Crescents
description: Combine the flour, cocoa, vanilla sugar, powdered sugar, salt and almonds in a bowl. Chop the butter into pieces, add to the bowl and knead. Finally, knead in the grated chocolate with cool hands. Wrap the dough in plastic wrap and chill for about 1 hour in the refrigerator.

title: Coconut Cream Layer Cake with Sliced Mango
description: For the filling, soak gelatin for 5 minutes in a bowl of cold water. Heat milk in a saucepan and stir in coconut cream until smooth. Squeeze excess water from gelatin and stir into coconut mixture until dissolved.  Stir in powdered sugar. Remove from heat and cool for 20-30 minutes. Stir in yogurt, coconut liqueur and lime juice. Briefly refrigerate until mixture starts to gel. Mix cream until stiff and fold into coconut mixture. Halve cake horizontally. Place bottom cake layer on plate and place a pastry ring around it. Spread coconut cream mixture over bottom cake layer until smooth. Place top cake layer over cream layer. Cover and refrigerate for 2-3 hours.

title: Chocolate and Cherry Cream Streusel Torte
description: Line bottom of springform pan 26 cm diameter (approximately 10 inches diameter) with parchment paper. With floured hands, press dough into prepared pan. Sprinkle streusel over dough and bake in oven preheated to 180°C (fan: 160°C, gas mark 2-3)(approximately 350°F) for 30-40 minutes. Let cake cool in pan for about 10 minutes. Remove cake from pan and cool completely on a wire rack.

title: Sangria Mousse with Orange Peach Compote
description: Mix egg yolks, remaining sugar, orange juice and orange zest in a bowl. Whisk egg yolk mixture over a hot water bath, then slowly stir into red wine syrup. Beat with the whisk of a hand mixer for five minutes until creamy. Let cool. Whip cream with vanilla sugar in a bowl until stiff. Add whipped cream to egg yolk mixture and fold in. Place mousse in a small bowl and refrigerate at least 5 hours.

title: Honey-Citrus Fried Dough Cakes
description: Transfer the dough to a floured surface and knead a few times. Shape the dough into walnut-sized balls and roll into oblong shapes. Heat the frying oil to 160°C (approximately 320°F). Working in batches, carefully drop the dough into the hot oil and fry until golden brown. Drain on paper towels.

title: Buckwheat Cake
description: Soak gelatin sheets in a bowl of cold water until softened, about 10 minutes. Whip the cream, add the sugar and vanilla and beat again until stiff. Dissolve gelatin over low heat and stir into the cream. Refrigerate for 10 to 15 minutes. Fold in the rose hip jam.

title: Creamy Soufflé with Strawberry and Raspberry Compote
description: For the souffle: Drain quark well. Heat butter in a pot. Add flour and saute briefly. Add milk and bring to a boil, whisking. Separate eggs. Whisk egg yolks, sugar and quark into butter mixture. Beat egg whites until stiff and fold into batter.

title: Raspberry Peach Cake
description: Remove from the oven and let cool briefly. Carefully remove from the pan and cool completely on a wire rack. Remove the parchment paper.

title: Latte Macchiato Gelatins with Whipped Cream
description: Heat 150 ml (approximately 2/3 cup) milk. Squeeze the remaining 6 sheets of gelatin and stir into milk until dissolved. Stir in remaining milk and almond syrup.

title: Rhubarb Tart with Strawberry Sorbet
description: Thaw the puff pastry. Place the sheets over each other and roll out on a lightly floured surface. Line a tart tin with the dough, forming an edge. Prick the dough several times with a fork, then refrigerate.

title: Yogurt Ice Cream with Wild Berries
description: Mix remaining berries and currants with 1 tablespoon sugar and refrigerate. Mix remaining sugar with lemon juice and yogurt.

title: Raspberry Cream Cake
description: For the filling, soak the gelatin for 5 minutes in cold water. Rinse and sort the raspberries and puree 1/2. Melt the dripping wet gelatin in a saucepan over low heat. Stir together the sugar, vanilla sugar and quark. Fold in the gelatin. Whip the cream until stiff and fold in. Divide the mixture in half and fold the raspberry purée into 1/2.

title: Grapefruit Cream
description: Bring the liquid to a boil in a small saucepan, stirring constantly. Remove from the heat and leave to cool over a pan of cold water. Then refrigerate for 2 hours, stirring occasionally.

title: Pistachio Parfait with Apricots
description: Remove from hot water bath and allow to cool slightly. Whip the cream. Chop pistachios and set aside about 1 teaspoon. Stir orange blossom water, yogurt, chopped pistachios and almonds into the whipped cream. Place the mixture in a small loaf pan and freeze for about 3 hours, stirring occasionally until the parfait is almost frozen. Then freeze undisturbed for 1 hour.

title: Apple Pancakes with Lingonberry Cream
description: Rinse the apples, cut into quarters, remove the cores and slice thinly. Toss with a bit of lemon juice to prevent browning.

title: Strawberry-Yogurt Shake
description: Divide the remaining strawberry ice scream into two glasses, then top with the shake. Garnish with glasses with a strawberry and sprig of lemon balm, and serve.

title: Almond Squares
description: Dice marzipan and dissolve in remaining milk. Add marzipan milk, remaining sugar and butter to well. Knead until smooth. Cover and let rise for 30 minutes. Knead in lemon, pine nuts and raisins. Let rise for 15 minutes more.

title: Mousse Au Chocolat with Grappa
description: Beat the egg and egg yolk with espresso powder and salt in a separate bowl. Beat until thick and frothy over a hot water bath. Stir in the Grappa and melted chocolate. Beat over a cold water bath until it comes to room temperature.Whip the cream until stiff and fold into the mixture. Pour the mousse into glasses and refrigerate. Serve garnished with candied violets, rose petals and chocolate pieces.

title: Chocolate Triangles with Raspberry Syrup
description: Spread batter in a greased baking pan, about 13 x 23 cm (approximately 5 x 9 inches). Cover with aluminum foil. Bake in preheated oven at 175°C (fan: 160°C, gas mark 2-3) (approximately 350°F), 40-45 minutes. Let cool completely.

title: Petite Chocolate Cakes with Apples and Vanilla Cream
description: Pour batter into 8 greased ramekins and cover with aluminum foil. Bake cakes in oven preheated to 175°C (fan: 160°C, gas mark 2-3)(approximately 350°F) for 40-45 minutes and let cool.

title: Apple Cranberry Muffins
description: Combine the flour, baking powder and gingerbread spice in a large bowl. Stir in the cranberries and apples and mix until smooth.
types: ['Baking', 'pastry', 'muffin', 'Light Cake', 'Dough', 'tart', 'Vegan', 'Vegan Baking', 'Vegan Cake and Cookie', 'Vegan Breakfast', 'Vegan Snack', 'Fruit', 'Course', 'Snack', 'Menu', 'Dessert']

title: Chocolate Espresso Macaroons
description: Using two teaspoons, scoop walnut-sized mounds onto a baking sheet lined with parchment paper. Bake in an oven preheated to 160°C/140°C convection/gas mark 2 (approximately 325°F/285°F convection) for 25-35 minutes. Remove from the oven, allow to cool and dust with cocoa powder before serving.

title: Glazed Spiced Cookies with Amaretto and Apricot
description: Place dough between sheets of parchment paper and roll out in a thin layer, about 1 cm (approximately 1/3 inch) thick. Cut out circles with a round cookie cutter, about 3 cm (approximately 1 inch) diameter. Place cookies on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper. Bake in preheated oven at 200°C (fan: 180°C, gas mark 3-4) (approximately 400°F), about 15 minutes. Cool cookies on a wire rack.

title: Icebox Custard Ring with Chocolate Sauce
description: For the custard, pour milk into a pot. Halve vanilla bean lengthwise and scrape out seeds with a sharp knife. Add vanilla bean and seeds to milk and heat slowly. Thoroughly mix egg yolk and sugar in a bowl. Remove vanilla pod from milk. Pour milk in a thin stream into egg yolk mixture, stirring constantly. Set bowl over a hot-water bath and beat custard mixture until thickened and frothy. Set bowl over a cold-water bath and stir custard mixture until chilled through. Beat cream until stiff and fold into custard mixture.

title: White Chocolate Berry Bundt Cake
description: Beat eggs with sugar until fluffy. Gradually beat butter and almonds into egg mixture. Mix flour and baking powder and stir into batter. Divide batter in half. Stir berry puree, lemon juice, liqueur and remaining berries into one portion of batter. Stir white chocolate into other portion of batter.

title: Spicy Balsamic Figs with Cheese
description: Remove figs from marinade. With a zester, remove orange zest in fine strips. Cut Camembert into triangles. Place a triangle of cheese on each fig and secure with a toothpick. Drizzle with marinade and top with zest.

title: Blueberry Pancakes
description: Mix the apricot jam and orange juice. Rinse the blueberries.

title: Wine Cream Cake with Fruit
description: Remove from oven and allow cake to cool for 10 minutes in the pan. Then carefully remove from the pan and allow to cool on a wire rack lined with parchment paper.

title: Apple Pancakes with Elderberry Sauce
description: For the sauce, mix the cornstarch with a little elderberry juice. Boil the remaining elderberry juice with the sugar and lemon juice and then stir in the cornstarch. Bring to a boil and allow to cool.

title: Raspberry Tart
description: Peel and core apples, cut into thin slices. Spread apple slices on the pastry and sprinkle with 2 tablespoons of sugar. Bake in preheated oven at 200°C (gas mark 3-4, fan oven 180°C) (approximately 400°F) for about 20 minutes. Remove from the oven and cool.

title: Yogurt Cake with Mixed Fruits
description: For the filling, soak the gelatin in cold water for 5 minutes according to instructions. Heat orange mango juice. Add gelatin and stir to dissolve. Refrigerate. When the juice starts to gel, stir in yogurt and vanilla sugar. Refrigerate until the mixture starts to gel. Beat the cream until stiff and fold in.

title: Blueberry Apricot Tart

Bake in preheated oven at 200°C (gas mark 3-4, fan oven 180°C) (approximately 400°F) for about 20-25 minutes.

Combine flour with baking powder and almonds and mix into butter cream alternating with the milk. Divide batter in half. In one half add 50 grams (approximately 2 ounces) grated coconut and liqueur. Into the other half, add chopped chocolate mint leaves and lukewarm couverture.

title: Apple and Raisin Cake

Place apple slices close together over the dough and sprinkle with raisins. Let rest 10-15 minutes. Bake in preheated oven at 200°C (approximately 400°F) for 20-30 minutes. Let cool.

Scoop the sorbet into the frozen orange shells, garnish with lemon balm and serve immediately.
