title: Vanilla Croissants with Chocolate
description: Line the baking trays with baking paper. Cut each rolls into 15 thick slices, each about 1 cm (approximately ½ inch) thick. Shape each slice into small croissant and lay on the baking trays. Bake in a preheated oven at 160°C (fan: 140°C, gas mark 2) (approximately 320°F) for about 12 minutes. Remove the trays from the oven and leave to cool.

title: Chilled Cherry Soup with Egg White Dumplings
description: Beat the egg whites with the sugar until stiff. Fill a large pot with 4 cm (approximately 1 1/2 inches) of water, and bring to a boil. Form quenelles using 2 teaspoons, then add to the boiling water. Cover and cook for 3 minutes, then flip the dumplings and cook another 3 minutes.

title: Snow Eggs with Raspberry Cream
description: Rinse the raspberries, puree and strain through a sieve. Sweeten with honey. Whip the cream to soft peaks and fold into the raspberry sauce. Divide between bowls.

title: Coconut Rice with Blueberries
description: Remove from heat and stir in rice syrup. Let cool, uncovered, for approximately 15 minutes. Whip cream with soy cream and fold into rice. Rinse blueberries and pat dry. Fold berries into rice, place into bowls and serve.

title: Strawberry Ice Cream Cake
description: For the sorbet: Bring the sugar and about 200 ml of water to a boil. Reduce the heat and simmer for about 5 minutes. Remove from heat and let cool. Rinse, hull and puree the strawberries. Stir the lemon juice and sugar syrup into the strawberry puree. Whip the egg whites until stiff and fold into the strawberry mixture.

title: Buttermilk Gelée
description: Rinse the strawberries, pat dry, remove the core and halve. Puree half of the berries with the powdered sugar.

title: Stuffed Courgette Flowers
description: For the courgette flowers, gently rinse flowers and pat dry. Carefully open flower blossoms and gently remove pistils with stamens.

title: Small Pavlova with Berries
description: Prepare filling. Combine quark with vanilla sugar and rose water, mix until smooth. Beat cream until stiff and fold into quark. Clean raspberries and add about half of them into quark mixture. Pour filling into Pavolvas. Rinse, dry, hull and slice strawberries. Arrange strawberries and remaining raspberries on top of Pavlovas. Sprinkle with pistachios.

title: Cherry-Peach Semifreddo
description: In a bowl, stir the yolks with the sugar and vanilla sugar. Place over a pot of simmering water and mix with a hand mixer until thick and creamy. Remove from heat and continue mixing over a cold water bath until cooled. Mix in the mascarpone until smooth. In a separate bowl, mix the egg whites and lemon juice with a hand mixer until stiff peaks are formed. In  separate bowl, mix the cream with a hand mixer until stiff peaks are formed. Gently fold the egg whites and cream into the mascarpone mixture.

title: Elderberry Soup with Dumplings
description: For the dumplings: beat egg whites with lemon juice until stiff, gradually add sugar. Bring milk to a boil and remove from heat. With 2 tablespoons, take egg white mixture and place into hot milk. Cook, turning over, for about 3 minutes. Remove with a slotted spoon and place on a kitchen towel. Pour soup into bowls and garnish with dumplings and mint leaves. Serve.

title: Smoked Trout and Herb Crêpes
description: For the crêpes: Whisk together the herbs, eggs, flour, milk and salt. Set aside for 15 minutes. Cook thin crêpes in hot butter and keep warm.

title: Chocolate and Almond Bear Paws
description: Beat the egg whites until stiff, sprinkle the suagr gradually and continue beating until the mixture turns white and shiny.
types: ['pastry', 'Cookie', 'gluten-free cookie', 'butter-free cookie', 'Flourless Cookie', 'German Spritz Cookie', 'Macaroon', 'Christmas pastry', 'Christmas Cookie', 'Christmas Cookie', 'Classic', 'cooking for one', 'Dessert']

title: Creme Brulee with Berries
description: Cut the vanilla bean in half lengthwise and scrape out the seeds. Boil the milk and the cream with the vanilla seeds, vanilla bean and the zest. Beat the egg yolks with the sugar until creamy, but not foamy. Gradually add the hot vanilla cream into the egg yolk mixture, whisking constantly. Pour the cream through a strainer into ramekins. Place the ramekins on a deep baking sheet or in a roasting pan. Pour in enough water to reach about 2/3 up the sides of the ramekins. Bake oven for about 60 minutes or until thickened.

title: Rhubarb with Meringue Topping
description: Arrange rhubarb in an ovenproof dish. Beat egg whites until very stiff, gradually add remaining sugar, beating constantly. Fold in almonds.

title: Rice Cream with Berries
description: Add pear juice and let cool. Whip cream. Rinse and dry berries, set aside some strawberries and raspberries for garnishing. Chop the rest of berries and mix with rice. Fold in cream.

title: Strawberry Meringue Pancakes
description: Beat egg whites in a bowl with remaining sugar until stiff.

title: Grapefruit and Rhubarb Compote with Rosewater
description: Peel the grapefruit with a sharp knife carefully, and remove the pith. Section the grapefruit, chop, and add to the cooled rhubarb mixture. Serve in dessert bowls or glasses, top with a dollop of whipped cream, and garnish with the lemon zest.

title: Berry Compote
description: Cut vanilla bean lengthwise and scrape out seeds. Rinse citrus fruit in hot water and dry. With a potato peeler, peel citrus skin thinly, squeeze out juice. Combine citrus peel, citrus juice, red wine and sugar and bring to a boil. Let stand for 10 minutes, strain through a fine sieve. Add half of fruit and bring to a boil again.

title: Berry Compote
description: Cut vanilla bean lengthwise and scrape seeds. Rinse orange and lemon in hot water, dry. With a potato peeler, peel orange and lemon skin thinly, squeeze out juices. Combine citrus peels, citrus juice, red wine and sugar and bring to a boil. Let stand for 10 minutes, then strain through a fine sieve. Add half of berries and bring to a boil.

title: Baked Vanilla Cream with Berries
description: Slit the vanilla bean lengthwise and scrape out the marrow. Add the pod and the marrow to the milk and bring to a boil.

title: Tea Tiramisu
description: Mix the coffee and brandy. Briefly immerse half of the ladyfingers in the coffee and line the bottom of a baking dish. Spread half of the cream on top and top with a second layer of soaked ladyfingers. Spread the remaining cream on top.

title: Banana in Crispy Dough
description: Fry in hot oil for 4-5 minutes. Drain on paper towels.

title: Blackberry Mousse
description: Beat Combine egg yolks, liqueur, lemon juice and powdered sugar until creamy over a double boiler. Squeeze out gelatin and stir into egg yolk mixture. Remove from heat, beat until cold and stir in quark, cream cheese and blackberry puree. Beat cream until stiff and fold into mixture. Pour mousse into a bowl, cover and chill for at least 3 hours.

title: Cherry Crumble
description: Preheat the oven to 180°C (approximately 350°F).

title: Vanilla-Raspberry Parfait
description: Bring another pot with water to a simmer and place the bowl with the egg-sugar mixture over it. This should not touch the water, but just hang over the simmering water. Slowly whisk in the hot vanilla milk, remove the pod and cook until thickened and creamy, about 10 minutes, stirring constantly. Then place bowl over an ice water bath and whisk until egg mixture cools.

title: Sponge Cake with Vanilla Cream and Strawberries
description: For the cake: Separate the eggs. Beat the egg whites with the salt until stiff. Gradually sprinkle in the sugar and continue beating until stiff and cut resistant. Whisk the yolks and fold in the egg whites. Mix the two flours with the cornstarch and sift over the egg mixture. Fold to combine. Pour the batter into the pan and bake in the preheated oven for about 35 minutes, until a toothpick comes out clean.
types: ['Berry Cake', 'Strawberry dessert', 'cake or tart with fruit', 'Sponge Cake', 'strawberry torte', 'European', 'Summer Cake', 'Easter Cake', 'Garden Party', 'Sweet', 'cooking for one', 'weekend cooking', 'Fruit', 'Dessert', 'Cream', 'Strawberry Dessert']

title: Frozen Strawberry Souffle
description: Cut parchment paper into strips that are about 1.5 cm (approximately1/2 inch) higher than the souffle cups and 2 cm (approximately 3/4 inch) longer than the circumference. Line the cups.

title: Yogurt Mousse with Strawberries
description: Combine lime zest, 2 tablespoons of juice and sugar. Heat through in a pot, but do not boil. Add gelatine and stir until dissoloved.
types: ['Dessert', 'Low-fat Dessert', 'Gluten-free Dessert', 'non-alcoholic', 'egg-free', 'Spring', 'Summer', 'festively', 'Guest', 'Sweet', 'weekend cooking', 'Cream', 'Strawberry cream', 'Strawberry Dessert', 'easy dessert', 'Mousse', 'Fruit Dessert']

title: Fruity Ricotta Cream
description: Beat egg yolks with powdered sugar until creamy. Combine ricotta, orange and lemon peel, lemon juice and 2 tablespoons of honey. Mix well. Dissolve softened gelatine in a small saucepan on low heat and stir into ricotta cream. Place ricotta into heart-shaped ramekins and refrigerate for about 3 hours.

title: Red Fruit Jelly
description: Rinse star fruit and cut into slices. Serve red fruit jelly in bowls and add a scoop of ice cream and cape gooseberries. Garnish with mint and star fruit slices.

title: Pineapple with Poppy Cream
description: Place the slices on a baking sheet lined with aluminum foil, sprinkle with powdered sugar and caramelize slightly under the broiler.

title: Blueberry Yogurt Cream
description: Puree the rest of the berries with the orange juice, the lavender honey and orange zest. Mix with the yogurt.

title: Chocolate Pudding
description: Add cornstarch, cocoa powder, sugar and remaining milk. Stir together and bring to a boil.

title: Yogurt with Raspberries
description: Place on a plate, garnish with raspberries and raspberry leaves and serve.

title: Rice Pudding with Berries
description: Butter four ramekins and sprinkle with sugar.

title: Chocolate Cake
description: For the cake batter, separate the eggs. Beat the egg yolks, water, sugar and orange zest until creamy. Beat the egg whites with the vanilla sugar until stiff. Mix the flour, cornstarch and baking powder. Finely grate the chocolate and add to the flour mixture. Gradually add the egg yolk mixture and egg whites to the dry ingredients.

title: Walnut Cookies
description: Knead the butter, sugar, lemon zest, almond liquor, pumpkin pie spice, eggs, flour and ground walnuts into a smooth dough. Fold in the peanuts and chocolate chips.

title: Cabbage Strudel with Pomegranate-Yogurt Dessert
description: Preheat the oven to 180°C (approximately 350°F) convection. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.

title: Vanilla Raspberry Cream Cake
description: Remove from oven and carefully peel off paper.

title: Hazelnut Almond Chocolate Cake
description: Preheat the oven to 180°C (approximately 350°F). Butter and flour the bottom of the pan.

title: Chocolate Ice Cream Cake with Nuts
description: Combine the egg yolks with the sugar in a metal bowl and beat until light and creamy over a pan of hot (not boiling) water. Pour in the milk in a thin stream while whisking and beat again until thick and creamy.
types: ['Dessert', 'Cream Cake', 'Nut', 'Ice Cream', 'nut ice cream', 'chocolate ice cream']

title: Easter Chocolate Crisps
description: Spoon out small portions into colorful paper muffin cases. Leave to cool completely in the refrigerator and decorate as desired with colored chocolate eggs.

title: Chocolate Nut Tarts
description: For the crust, place the cornflakes in a freezer bag and crumble. Melt the chocolate over a hot water bath. Stir in the hazelnut oil and the cornflakes. Remove from the heat and divide between the ramekins. Let cool.

title: Spiced Rice Pudding
description: Sprinkle with the almonds and pistachios and serve warm.

title: Mixed Fruit Trifle
description: Rinse the blueberries and pat dry. Rinse the pears, remove the core, quarter, and thinly slice. Mix with the lemon juice.

title: Chocolate Pudding
description: Coarsely chop chocolate and melt in a bowl over a hot water bath, then allow to cool slightly. Stir in butter, both butter and chocolate should have roughly the same temperature before stirring.

title: Chocolate-Coated Pumpkin Hazelnut Cake
description: Rinse the orange, grate the zest and squeeze the juice. Rinse the zucchini. Finely grate the zucchini and the pumpkin pulp. Separate the eggs and in a mixing bowl beat the egg whites with 100 grams (approximately 3 1/2 ounces) sugar and the salt until stiff. In another bowl, beat the egg yolks with the remaining sugar until light and fluffy and stir in the orange juice in a thin stream. Mix the flour with the baking powder, cinnamon, ground nuts and the orange zest and stir into the egg yolks. Gently fold in the grated vegetables and the egg whites. Spoon into the cake pan, smooth the top and bake until a toothpick inserted near the center of the cake comes out clean, about 45 minutes.

title: Crepes with Pear Filling
description: Meanwhile, rinse pears, peel and cut into bite-sized pieces. Drizzle with the lemon juice. Slit the vanilla bean lengthwise and scrape out the marrow. Put the pears, the marrow, the pod and the wine in a pot. Put in 1-2 drops stevia and simmer for 5-10 minutes, until pears are tender. remove the vanilla pod, taste and sweeten as needed with stevia. Stir in the quark and the cinnamon. Beat the cream until stiff and fold in. Taste again and sweeten with stevia as needed.

title: Citrus Jelly with Blackberry Cream Cheese
description: For the blackberry cream cheese: Whisk the cream cheese, sugar, lemon juice and heavy cream together until smooth. Rinse the blackberries, pat dry and stir into the cream mixture, reserving a few for garnish. Spread the mixture over the citrus jelly and sprinkle with crushed lemon cookies. Garnish with the remaining blackberries and mint. Serve chilled.

title: Summer Berry Pudding
description: Cut cake into thin slices, set some slices aside for covering and line the edges of the pan with the rest of cake slices.

title: Cherry Frozen Yogurt
description: Mix the cherry puree, Kirsch and yogurt and then fold in the whipped cream.

title: Red Wine Poached Pears with Crème Brûlée
description: Before serving, dust the custards with brown sugar, and place under the broiler until the surface has caramelized (or put in an ice water bath and caramelize in a hot oven quickly).

title: Vanilla Poppyseed Ice Cream
description: Beat egg yolks and sugar in a bowl until creamy.

title: Dough Basket with Berries
description: Roll dough out thin and cut out circles. Place dough around upturned ovenproof dish lined with baking paper and press against dough to form basket shape. Lay piece of dough over another lined bowl to form basket handle shape.

title: Baked Apples with Almonds
description: Place the sliced almonds in a shallow dish.

title: Candied Fruit and Ricotta Gelatin
description: Soak gelatin in cold water.

title: Cherry Strudel with Phyllo Dough
description: Or for the pastry: Measure flour with salt in a mixing bowl, make a well in the center and add 2 tablespoons melted butter. Add egg yolks and mix everything, adding as much lukewarm water until a smooth dough forms. Knead until dough pulls away from edge of bowl. Dust a work surface with flour and knead dough by hand. Shape dough into a ball and brush with melted butter. Wrap in aluminum foil and let stand overnight. Place a large cloth on a work surface, sprinkle with flour, divide dough in half. For first sheet roll out dough as large as possible then brush with butter. Using the back of the hand, pull dough until it is very thin and covers the entire cloth.

title: Compote of Nectarines, Peaches and Strawberries
description: Rinse peaches and nectarines and cut into slices or pieces.

title: Baked Rice Pudding with Grapefruit
description: Soak raisins in rum. In a bowl, beat egg yolks with sugar until light. Stir mixture, along with raisins, into the cooled rice pudding. Beat egg whites until stiff, then carefully fold into rice pudding.

title: Rice Pudding with Prosecco
description: Pour 2 tablespoons prosecco into each of 4 stemmed glasses, then fill up with rice pudding. Garnish with mint leaves and raspberries and serve.

title: Rice Dumplings with Compote
description: Add beaten egg yolk to rice, mix well and cool. Halve and pit plums. Rinse grapes, halve, remove seeds and bring all fruit with remaining syrup and 2 tablespoons of water to a boil.

title: Fruit Rice Pudding
description: For the fruits, blanch peaches, rinse in cold water, peel, halve, core and dice finely. Trim strawberries, rinse and cut into small cubes. Mix both with lemon juice, liqueur and vanilla sugar and infuse for about 15 minutes.

title: Cherry Tarts
description: Rinse the cherries, pat dry and remove the pits. Rinse the raspberries. Place the cherries and raspberries in a large saucepan with the sugar and vanilla sugar. Mix well, cover the pan and let sit for about 30 minutes. Bring the mixture to a boil for 4 minutes. Remove from the heat and stir in the liqueur.
types: ['cherry tart', 'European', 'Italian', 'Dessert', 'Classic', 'Cake', 'Shortcrust', 'Fruit', 'cake or tart with fruit', 'Stone Fruit']

title: Cranberry Apple Crumble
description: Process flour with almonds, peanuts, butter, sugar, cinnamon and salt until crumbly and sprinkle over fruit.

title: Berries with Vanilla Cream
description: Trim and rinse the berries, cut the strawberries into pieces if desired. Arrange on plates. Mix the orange juice with the honey and drizzle over the berries. Scoop out some cream, put on the berries and serve garnished with lemon thyme and vanilla.

title: Cream Cheese Tartlets with Berries
description: Whisk egg yolk with 4 tablespoons of water, add to butter mixture  and knead to a smooth dough. Shape into a ball, wrap in plastic wrap and refrigerate for 30 minutes.

title: Steamed Rice with Apples
description: Rinse and halve apples, core and cut into thin slices. Heat butter in a pan and saute apple slices for about 3-4 minutes or until soft. Deglaze pan with orange juice and let stand for 5 minutes.

title: Strawberry Cream
description: Rinse the strawberries. Set aside 4 strawberry halves for the garnish and puree the rest. Heat the strawberries, sugar and lemon juice in a saucepan. Remove from the heat and stir in the squeezed gelatin. Let cool.
types: ['Cream', 'Gluten-free Dessert', 'non-alcoholic', 'egg-free', 'Spring', 'Summer', 'Meal for Four', 'Sweet', 'Dessert', 'Strawberry cream', 'Strawberry Dessert', 'Mousse', 'Fruit Dessert', 'dessert']

title: Berry and Rhubarb Compote with Elderflower
description: Add the lemon juice, vanilla sugar and elderflower syrup to the saucepan with the apple juice and bring to a boil. Add  the rhubarb, raspberries and strawberries, reduce to a simmer and cook until the fruit begins to fall apart, 5-10 minutes, gently stirring occasionally. Stir the cornstarch together  with the reserved apple juice until smooth and stir into the saucepan and simmer, stirring until lightly thickened. Let cool slightly, then spoon into jars and let cool.

title: Strawberry Granita
description: Just before serving, stir granita with a fork. Arrange strawberry granita in small glasses and serve garnished with walnuts and strawberry halves.

title: Blackberry Crumble
description: Preheat the oven to 180°C (approximately 350°F) on the convection setting.

title: Mini Dessert Burgers
description: Mix 130 butter with powdered sugar and vanilla until fluffy, stir in egg and fold in flour. Pour batter into piping bag with large nozzle and pipe balls about 3 cm (approximately 1 inch) onto baking paper. Bake for 13-14 minutes in oven then remove baking sheet from oven and let cool on wire rack.

title: Berries with Champagne and Ice Cream
description: Mix berries with chopped mint, lemon juice and icing sugar and let rest for about 1 hour. To serve, evenly distribute berries in glasses and fill with champagne. Crown each glass with one scoop of ice cream and garnish with remaining mint.

title: Chocolate Pudding
description: Garnish with colorful chocolate eggs and serve.

title: Strawberry Cream
description: Garnish with petals and serve.

title: Summer Berry Pudding
description: Cut the white bread into slices, remove the crust and line the bottom and sides of the mold with it. Fill with the berry mixture and top with the remaining bread. Cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate overnight.

title: Strawberry Shake with Woodruff
description: Soak the gelatin in cold water for 5-10 minutes. Squeeze out and melt in a saucepan over low heat. Stir in 2-3 tablespoons of the strawberry puree, then stir everything into the berry mixture. Chill in the refrigerator until the mixture begins to gel.
types: ['Cream', 'Gluten-free Dessert', 'non-alcoholic', 'Guest', 'Sweet', 'weekend cooking', 'Gelling Agent', 'Herb', 'Dairy', 'Fruit', 'Dessert', 'Strawberry cream', 'Strawberry Dessert', 'Mousse', 'Fruit Dessert', 'dessert']

title: Peach Gazpacho
description: Stir the basil into the peach puree and serve the puree in bowls. Garnish with the vanilla beans and peach slices.

title: Sweet Potato Gratin with Sorbet
description: For the gratin: peel sweet potatoes and cut into thin slices. Butter 4 ramekins. Combine cream with sugar. Layer potatoes in ramekins and pour cream over potatoes. Bake in preheated oven at 160°C (approximately 325°F) for about 30 minutes. Place a scoop of sorbet on top of each ramekin. Sprinkle with almonds and dust with powdered sugar. Serve.

title: Strawberry Meringue Ice Cream
description: Heat milk and cream in a saucepan. In the meantime, beat egg yolks with remaining sugar until white and fluffy. Pour hot milk into yolk mixture and stir over a hot water bath until mixture thickens. Do not allow to boil!

title: Yogurt with Cherries
description: 90 mins

title: Berry Gratin
description: Clean raspberries. Rinse strawberries and pat dry. Halve two berries and set aside for garnishing. Dice the rest of strawberries. Place strawberries and raspberries into ramekins.

title: Kalter Hund
description: Line a loaf pan with plastic wrap and spread some of the chocolate mixture on the bottom. Cover with shortbread and then top the shortbread with more of the chocolate mixture. Continue layering in this manner until all the ingredients are layered into the loaf pan, making the last layer the chocolate-almond mixture. Spread into a smooth layer, cover, and refrigerate at least 5 hours, and preferably overnight.

title: Puff Pastry Pies with Strawberries and Apples
description: Line 4 ovenproof pans with baking paper. Roll out puff pastry and line pans with it, making high edge all around. Cut the rest of pastry into circles to fit pans.

title: Apple Pancakes with Blueberries
description: Peel the apples and remove the core. Cut into thin, round slices and sprinkle with lemon juice. Melt the butter in a pan, add a quarter of the apple slices, pancake batter and 1-2 tablespoons of berries. Fry until golden brown, about 1-2 minutes  . With the help of a plate, turn the pancake over and bake until golden brown on the second side. Keep the finished pancakes warm in the oven at 80°C (approximately 175°F) and continue to make pancakes in this manner, until all the ingredients are used.

title: Whipped Cream with Apple Compote
description: Whip the cream, then fold in the yogurt and powdered sugar. Layer half of the compote into 4 glasses, followed by a layer of the cream. Repeat this process one more time, then sprinkle with the pistachios.

title: Cherry Clafouti with Pistachios
description: Spread half of the cherries in the dish and cover with half of the quark cream. Top with the rest of the cherries and remaining cream and sprinkle with the remaining pistachios. Bake the oven until golden brown, about 35 minutes. Serve warm.

title: Baked Apples with Walnuts
description: Rinse apples, cut off lids and core with an apple corer. Remove some pulp, being careful not to break skin. Cut apple pulp into small pieces and combine with nuts. Stuff apples with the mixture.  Place apples into a buttered baking dish, replace lids and dot with butter. Bake in preheated oven at 180°C (approximatley 350°F) for about 30 minutes or until golden brown.

title: Strawberry Soup with Lavender
description: 30 mins

title: Pistachio and Honey Ice Cream
description: Cool pistachio cream over an ice water bath, stirring occasionally. Mix chopped pistachios with honey and add to cream. Pour mixture into an ice cream maker and follow manufacturer's instructions. If you do not have an ice cream maker, pour into a shallow metal tray and freeze for about 4 hours, stirring during first hour.

title: Chocolate Covered Strawberries
description: Chop the chocolate and melt over a water bath. Allow to cool slightly and dip the strawberries into the chocolate to just under the green. Cool on baking paper.

title: Banana and Strawberry Puree
description: 15 mins

title: Cookie Filled Coconut Muffins
description: Beat the butter with the sugar, coconut syrup, lemon zest and juice until frothy, then gradually add the eggs and beat until smooth and creamy. Mix the flour with the grated coconut, baking powder and cornstarch and stir into the egg mixture alternately with the yogurt. The batter will be thick.

title: Sweet Strawberry Soup
description: Pick through the raspberries, wipe clean and blend with the powdered sugar until finely pureed. Press through a sieve. Pour the soup into cups, stir in the raspberry puree and serve garnished with mint leaves.

title: Chocolate Strawberry Crepes
description: For the batter, stir milk with flour until smooth. Add eggs and mix well. Melt the butter in a pan, let cool briefly and stir into the batter with sugar and 1 pinch of salt. Allow batter to sit for 10-15 minutes.

title: Raspberry Clafoutis
description: Rinse fresh raspberries and pat dry gently or thaw frozen raspberries.

title: Buttermilk Flummery with Mixed Berries
description: Rinse berries and pat dry.

title: Mixed Fruit Jelly with Lemony Rice Pudding and Pine Nuts
description: Finely grate the lemon zest and squeeze the juice. Bring the milk to a boil along with the lemon zest and honey. Add the rice, cover and let simmer for about 20 minutes over low heat, stirring occasionally. Season with the lemon juice and spoon into serving glasses.

title: Chocolate Pudding with Oranges
description: Soak gelatin in cold water.

title: Sweet Coconut Sushi Rice with Fruit
description: Meanwhile, rinse, hull and cut strawberries into thin slices. Halve the papaya and remove the seeds. Cut the flesh into thin slices.

title: Goat Cheese on Pear Bed with Truffle Sauce
description: Combine sugar with about 100 ml (approximately 2/5 cup) of water and bring to a boil. Simmer for about 5 minutes on low heat until syrupy. Remove from heat and let cool slightly. Rinse one pear and cut into slices. Place into syrup ad let stand for about 5 minutes. Remove with a slotted spoon and arrange on a lined with parchment paper baking sheet. Dry in preheated oven at 100°C (approximately 200°F) for about 1.5-2 hours.

title: Goat Cheese with Strawberry on Kiwi Sauce
description: To serve, place the goat cheese on plate, top with some kiwi sauce and top with the strawberries. Garnish with pistachios and almond pastries, if desired.

title: 7 Layer Chocolate Cake
description: For the batter: Separate the eggs. Beat egg yolks with the sugar until light and fluffy. Mix together the salt, lemon zest and melted butter and then stir in the flour, cornstarch and baking powder a bit at a time. Whip the egg whites until stiff and fold carefully into the egg and flour mixture. Divide the batter into 8 portions.

title: Chocolate Layered Dessert with Berries
description: Thaw the berries. For the cake, separate the eggs. Mix the yolks with 40 grams (approximately 2 tablespoons) sugar until fluffy. Beat the egg whites with 1 pinch of salt until stiff and sprinkle in 40 grams (approximately 2 tablespoons) of sugar. Continue beating until the mixture shines and forms stiff peaks.

title: Poached Pears with Kumquats
description: Rinse and slice the kumquats.

title: Frozen Strawberry Cream
description: Place the egg yolks, the whole egg, sugar and vanilla sugar in a heatproof bowl set over, not in, a pan of simmering water and beat until creamy. Remove from the heat and stir in half of the strawberry puree. In a separate bowl, beat the cream to stiff peaks and fold into the egg yolk mixture.

title: Nut Ring with Dried Fruit and Chocolate Stripes
description: Place the nuts and fruits in a bowl and pour the caramel mixture over them. Mix well and immediately pour into a buttered ring mold (about 20 cm/8 inches in diameter) and press into an even layer. Spread the couverture chocolate  over the fruit-nut mixture. Let cool.
types: ['Cake', 'Fruitcake', 'No-Bake Cake', 'nut torte', 'cake or tart with fruit', 'Gluten-free', 'Gluten-free Snack', 'Gluten-free Vegetarian Recipe', 'Gluten-free Dessert', 'Gluten-free Breakfast', 'egg-free', 'Vegetarian', 'Advent', 'Christmas', 'Christmas pastry', 'Christmas Cake', 'Rustic', 'crowdpleaser', 'Country Style', 'Sweet', 'Quick', 'Nut', 'Fruit', 'Snack', 'Dessert']

title: Grilled Fruit Skewers
description: Brush the figs and cut into thick slices. Rinse the pears, quarter, core and halve again.

title: Sweet Italian Risotto with Strawberries and Pistachios
description: Rinse, dry and halve strawberries.

title: Red Fruit Jelly
description: Pour the fruits through a sieve, squeeze pulp well, collect the juice and heat to a boil. Combine the cornstarch with a little cold water and stir into the fruit sauce. Mix in the remaining fruit and heat it up briefly.

title: Sweet Fruit Sushi
description: Knead marzipan with food coloring on a surface dusted with powdered sugar. Put between two layers of plastic wrap and roll 1 to 1.5 mm (approximately 1/50 inch) thick. Remove plastic wrap and cut marzipan into 1 cm (approximately 1/3 inch) wide strips.

title: Strawberry Cottage Cheese Dumplings
description: For the dumplings, drain the cottage cheese very well. Mix with the egg, flour, semolina, breadcrumbs, sour cream, sugar, and lemon zest to form a dough. description: For the meringue: Beat egg whites with a pinch of salt until stiff, gradually add sugar. Then add ground nuts and mix well. Pour into a piping bag and form 8 circles, about 7 cm (approximately 2 3/4 inches) in diameter, on a lined baking tray. Bake for 30 minutes.

description: Puree the fruit with the pear juice and kefir. If the drink is too thick, stir in some mineral water.

description: Rinse the strawberries, pat dry and slice thinly. Spoon the rice into small serving bowls and top with the sliced strawberries. Sprinkle with coconut strips, garnish with lemon balm and serve.

description: Peel the grapefruit carefull with a sharp knife, making sure to remove all of the bitter white pith. Separate the whole fruit segments. Garnish with grated lemon zest and serve.

description: Add berries to the mixture and place into glasses. Sprinkle with sugar and serve.

description: Rinse strawberries, remove stems and puree. Combine with cream cheese. Place mixture into a piping bag with the star tip and pipe cream decoratively onto pears. Serve.

title: Strawberry Puree
description: Serve with whipped cream.

title: Rhubarb Compote with Strawberries
description: In a bowl, mix together the cornstarch and enough of the apple juice to dissolve the cornstarch.

description: Grease a pan and place the apples inside. Top with the orange zest, pistachios and star anise. Place 2 cinnamon sticks in the pan and cook for about 20 minutes at 200°C (approximately 400°F). Serve immediately.

description: Beat the cream until stiff and fold into the mixture. Pour the espresso cream into glasses and chill for at least 2 hours.

description: Rinse and trim rhubarb, cut into pieces and sprinkle with sugar. In a pan, cook rhubarb with butter, 100 ml of water, lime juice and zest. Add strawberries, cook briefly. title: Blackberry Ice Cream

Freeze about 4 hours, occasionally stirring with a fork to prevent large ice crystals from forming. To serve, scoop ice cream into bowls and garnish with blackberries and mint. Dust with powdered sugar.

title: Fruit Jelly

title: Strawberries with Mint Sauce

Lightly toast pine nuts in a dry frying pan. Remove and let cool. Set 1 teaspoon aside for garnish. Combine peppermint leaves with pine nuts, lemon juice, half of the finely grated lemon zest, apple juice and 1 tablespoon honey. Puree until smooth. Mix the remaining grated lemon zest with 2 tablespoons honey. Rinse strawberries, pat dry and hull. With a sharp knife, cut strawberries into thin slices and spread on a platter. Drizzle with the honey-lemon mixture. Cover and let stand about 20 minutes. Mix the mint sauce with creme fraiche and cream. To serve, divide strawberries among dessert bowls, drizzle with mint sauce and garnish with reserved mint leaves, pine nuts and lemon zest.

title: Creme Brulee

Pour boiling water onto the sheet until the ramekins are immersed in the water.

title: Fruit Skewers

title: Berry Puree with Yogurt
description: Divide among bowls and add 1 tablespoon of yogurt. Serve with mint garnish.

title: Rice Pudding with Red Fruit Sauce
description: In a small bowl, dissolve the cornstarch with a little cold water until smooth. Stir the cornstarch mixture into the saucepan and simmer, stirring all the while until the mixture is lightly thickened. Set aside.

Mix the flour, nuts, cocoa powder, cornstarch and grated chocolate. Add the egg yolk mixture and the lukewarm butter. Fold together.

description: The compote may be served with vanilla ice cream.

Place the egg whites over the hot water bath, and mix the cooked sugar rapidly into the egg whites with a hand mixer. Stir until the egg whites and sugar have combined fully, add the honey and beat for 15-25 minutes. Mix in the cocoa butter and nuts.

description: Melt the butter over low heat, add the sugar, breadcrumbs and almonds and caramelize while stirring.

Add the egg yolks and whisk over medium heat to make the sabayon. Season with cinnamon. Ladle the sabayon into deep bowls and top with the plums.

title: Spice Cake
description: Pour in the batter into the pan and smooth the surface. Bake in a preheated oven (180°C; convection 160°C) (approximately 350°F, convection 325°F) for about 1 hour. Remove cake from pan and cool on a wire rack. For the glaze, melt chopped couverture chocolate over a simmering water bath and spread over the cake. Top with almonds and sliced ​​figs and allow to dry before slicing and serving.

Refrigerate dough strips for about 10 minutes. Preheat oven to 180°C (approximately 350°F). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper. Set dough strips on prepared baking sheet sheet, press gently to flatten slightly and bake 20-25 minutes. Cut each strip into 14 triangular biscuits. Melt chocolate over a hot-water bath and brush over gingerbread biscuits while still warm. Let chocolate dry before serving biscuits.

title: Cold Strawberry Soup with Champagne Jelly
description: Add the champagne to the syrup. Heat 6 tablespoons of the liquid in a small saucepan, squeeze out the gelatin, and add it to the liquid. Stir until dissolved. Pour into the remaining liquid, add into a shallow baking dish, and chill for at least 4 hours in the refrigerator.

title: Indonesian Coconut Rice
description: Mix coconut milk, salt and water. Strain through a sieve and bring to a boil.

title: Elderberry Soup with Dumplings
description: For the soup: Rinse the berries, strip from the stems and put in another pot.

title: Poached Pears with Honey-Almond Crumble
description: Heat the ghee in a pan and sauté the grated ginger briefly. Add the chopped almonds and shredded coconut and sauté until toasted. Stir in the honey, mix well and spoon the warm mixture over the pears. Garnish with the toasted almonds and serve immediately.

title: Fruit and Bread Appetizers
description: Rinse, trim and halve the fruit. Pit apricots and cut into wedges. Thread the fruit on 12 small skewers and then stick in the bread pieces.

title: Champagne with Strawberries
description: Pour the puree in four cocktail glasses, pour champagne and 1 scoop of strawberry ice cream.

title: Apple-Lemon Sorbet

Bring the lemon juice of 3 lemons, lemon zest, apple pieces and pulp of the hollowed apples (cored and seeds), water and cinnamon to a boil. Cover and simmer over low heat for 10 minutes. Then pour into a metal bowl and stir in the sugar.

title: Apple Slices in Syrup
description: Spread the apple slices with a little syrup onto dessert bowls. Add the whipped cream to a pastry bag and decorate as you wish. Lightly sprinkle with cinnamon, and garnish with the sliced lemons and zest.

title: Baked Semolina Pudding with Apples
description: Beat egg whites until stiff peaks form, then fold into semolina mixture. Spread mixture onto apples. Bake on the center rack of a preheated oven (180°C, or approximately 350°F), 50-60 minutes. Remove from oven and serve warm, sprinkled with cinnamon sugar and almonds.

title: Summer Pudding
description: Trim the crust from the bread. Cut a slice of bread so that it snugly fits the bottom of a 1 liter (approximately 4 cups) bowl. Line the sides of the bowl with the 4 or 5 slices of bread, depending on the shape of the bowl.

title: Fruit Salad
description: Rinse the berries and pat dry. Cut the strawberries into smaller pieces. Mix the prepared fruit. Stir the orange juice, honey and cardamom. Mix the juice mixture with the fruit. Pour the fruit salad into a bowl and pour in the buttermilk. Serve garnished with lemon balm.

title: Chocolate Cream Cake
description: For the garnish, gently whip the egg white. Dip the violets into the egg white and dust with powdered sugar. Let dry on parchment paper for about 2 hours.

title: Pears with Marsala Syrup
description: Carefully lift out the pears, drain, and add to a small bowl. Simmer the mixture over medium heat until reduced to a syrup, 5-10 minutes. Pour the syrup over the pears, and let cool. Garnish with the mint leaves.

title: Strawberry Soup
description: Blend the strawberries with sugar, 3/4 of cream, yogurt, orange and lemon juice and Grand Marnier in a blender until smooth.

title: Cherries Dipped in White Chocolate and Coconut
description: Let cool slightly. Dip the cherries halfway into the chocolate, then sprinkle the coconut flakes on to stick to the chocolate. put in paper baking cups and let dry. Arrange the cherries on plates as desired and serve with champagne.

title: Raspberry Cream

title: Pears with Saffron Syrup
description: Remove pears and let cool. Boil to reduce the sauce to half, strain through a sieve into a bowl and let cool also. Serve pears with a little syrup on plates.

title: Strawberry Soup with Egg White Dumplings
description: Using two wet tablespoons, form the beaten egg whites into dumplings about the size of lemons. Slide the dumplings into the water and let cook about 1 minute. Flip the dumplings and cook another minute.

title: Blueberry-Yogurt Soup
description: Serve in bowls and garnish with the reserved blueberries.

title: Blinis with Raspberry Sauce
description: Beat egg whites until stiff and fold into batter before baking.

title: Coffee-Banana Smoothie
description: Puree coffee with the remaining banana, vanilla, nuts and honey in a blender until frothy. Pour into a glass and serve garnished with a fruit skewer, if desired.

title: Sweet Rice Rings with Berries
description: Remove vanilla bean from rice. Let rice cool slightly, spoon into four small greased ring molds and press gently. Invert molds and remove rice rings onto serving plates. Rinse berries and pluck or hull as necessary. Rinse star fruit and lime and cut into slices.

title: White Chocolate Star Cake
description: Miscellaneous subset store up for baking in the refrigerator, then bake as well. The when cool star once each in half a.

title: Russian Honey Cake
description: Add the honey, sugar, vanilla sugar, margarine and milk to a saucepan and heat slowly, while stirring. Place in a bowl and allow to cool, but not solidify. Gradually add the egg, almond extract and spices; stir everything together. Sift the flour with the cocoa and baking powder. Stir the flour mixture, in spoonfuls, into the honey mixture. Finally, add the soaked raisins and currants, candied lemon and orange and walnuts and mix everything together.

title: Pineapple Ginger Tart
description: For the cake, beat margarine, sugar, vanilla, salt, arrack flavor and ginger until creamy and gradually stir in egg yolks. Mix flour and baking powder, sift over margarine mixture and fold in with a whisk to a smooth batter. Beat egg whites until stiff and fold into batter with pineapple and almonds. Line the bottom of an 18 cm diameter springform pan with parchment paper. Spread batter in prepared pan and bake in oven preheated to 180°C (fan: 160°C, gas mark 2-3)(approximately 350°F) 45-50 minutes. Immediately release springform pan and invert pan to remove cake to a wire rack lined with parchment paper. Let cake cool and remove parchment paper.

title: Pear Puree with Fruit Topping
description: Peel the mango, cut the flesh from the core, then cut it into columns. Peel the kiwis and cut into slices. Cut the pomegranate in half and remove the seeds. Cut the remaining pear into quarters, remove the seeds and cut into thin slices.

title: Chocolate Mousse
description: Beat eggs until thick and frothy. Stir in the quark. Add dripping wet gelatin to a pot and simmer over low heat while stirring until dissolved. Stir gelatin into the quark mixture. Finally, stir in the couverture. Place the mixture in the refrigerator for 3-4 hours.

title: Chocolate Chunk Frozen Dessert with Cherries
description: In a saucepan, heat cherry jam and rum. Add sour cherries and cook for about 5 minutes. Remove from heat and let cool.

title: Crepes with Rhubarb Compote
description: For the crepes, mix flour, salt, vanilla and milk in a bowl and let rest for 30 minutes. Then add eggs and mix. Melt butter in a pan and fry crepe batter in portions until golden brown.

title: Strawberries with Vanilla Zabaglione
description: Place four ladyfingers in each of four small bowls. Divide strawberries over ladyfingers.

title: Creamy Rice Pudding with Blueberries
description: Beat cream until stiff and fold into the rice.

title: White Mousse with Raspberry Puree
description: Beat the egg yolks and sugar in a bowl. Remove the vanilla pod from the milk. In a thin stream, pour the milk into the egg yolks, stirring constantly. Continue stirring over a hot water bath until the mixture thickens, but do not let it boil. Squeeze out the gelatin and dissolve it into the mousse. Refrigerate until it starts to gel. Whip the cream until stiff and fold into the mousse. Refrigerate.

title: Tempura Apples with Syrup
description: Heat oil in a deep fryer or large pan to 175°C (approximately 350°F). Pierce apple pieces with a fork and dip in batter. Fry in hot oil until crispy. Drain on paper towels.

title: Applesauce and Vanilla Pudding Pie
description: For the filling, soak gelatin in cold water for about 5 minutes. In a saucepan, heat half of white wine. Squeeze excess water from gelatin. Add gelatin to pan and stir into wine, until dissolved. Stir in remaining white wine, applesauce and cinnamon. Remove from heat.

title: Honey Cake
description: Combine raisins, candied lemon and almonds, then knead into dough. Line the bottom of a springform pan (24 cm or 10 inches in diameter) with parchment paper. Pour in dough and spread even, then let rise for another 15 minutes.

title: Cherry Cream Cake
description: Line the bottom of a springform pan (26 cm or 10 inches in diameter) with parchment paper. Pour in batter and bake in an oven preheated to 170°C (approximately 350°F) for about 45 minutes. Remove and let cool for 10 minutes, then release from pan and let cool on a wire rack. Peel off parchment.

title: Custard Tart
description: Line a baking sheet with parchment paper. Knead the dough on a floured surface and roll out to the size of the prepared baking sheet. Place the dough on the baking sheet, pushing the edges to form a crust.

title: Zuppa Inglese
description: Line the bottom of a springform pan (26 cm diameter) (approximately 10 inches) with parchment paper. Pour in the dough. Bake in a preheated oven at 200°C (approximately 400°F) (gas mark 3-4, convection 180°C or 350°F) for 20-30 minutes. Carefully remove the cake from the pan and turn out onto a wire rack lined with baking paper and remove the baking paper from the top. Let cool fully, then cut twice horizontally to form 3 layers. Cut into 1x4 cm (1/2 x 1 1/2 inch) strips. Brush half of the sponge strips with liqueur and the other half with rum. Cover and set aside for 1 hour.

title: Fruit Blossom Bread
description: Knead dough on a floured surface. Roll out dough on a 25 cm diameter (approximately 10 inch diameter) round baking sheet lined with parchment paper and cut out a flower. Knead dough scraps, roll out again and cut out stem and leaf shapes. Carefully attach stem and leaf shapes to flower and press gently. Whisk egg yolk, brush over dough and let stand for about 10 minutes. Bake flower bread in oven preheated to 175°C (fan: 160°C, gas mark 2-3) (approximately 350°F) for about 20 minutes. Carefully remove flower bread from baking sheet and let cool on a wire rack.

title: Apricot and Almond Bars
description: For the dough, mix together the flour, yeast, 40 grams (approximately 2 tablespoons) of sugar, lemon zest, softened butter, egg and lukewarm milk. Knead to make a smooth dough. Cover and let sit for about 20 minutes in a warm place. Knead the dough again and roll out and place in a greased baking pan, cover and let rise.

title: Almond Orange Muffins with Chocolate Drizzle
description: Rinse orange with hot water, pat dry, zest and juice. Stir orange zest and juice into butter mixture. Mix flour, cornstarch, baking powder and ground almonds and stir into butter mixture to a smooth batter.
types: ['Baking', 'Tartlet', 'Eggs', 'Nut', 'Tropical Fruit', 'Dessert', 'Buffet', 'German', 'Family', 'Cooking on vacation', 'festively', 'crowdpleaser', 'Garden Party', 'Guest', 'Birthday', 'birthday for kids', 'Party', 'Picnic', 'Sweet', 'weekend cooking']

title: Chocolate Orange Cream Cake
description: Separate eggs and beat whites with 140 grams (approximately 2/3 cup) sugar and a pinch of salt until stiff. Beat butter until creamy, gradually add egg yolks and stir in orange zest, melted chocolate, orange liqueur and remaining sugar. Fold about 1/3 of the egg whites into butter mixture and fold in remaining egg whites. Sprinkle flour mixture over batter and fold in with a whisk. Line the bottom of a 26 cm diameter (approximately 10 inch diameter) springform pan with baking paper. Spread batter in prepared pan and bake in oven preheated to 175°C (fan: 160°C, gas mark 2-3)(approximately 350°F) for 50-60 minutes. Let cake cool about 10 minutes in pan. Loosen cake from pan and invert to remove cake to a wire rack lined with parchment paper. Remove parchment paper from bottom of cake and let cool.

title: Truffles with Pear Liqueur
description: Cool the mixture slightly and stir into the chocolate. Refrigerate until the mixture can be poured into a piping bag. Use a large star tip large fill and pipe into the chocolate molds.

title: Poppy Seed Roll
description: Add the remaining sugar. Cut the butter and clarified butter into pieces and process to make a smooth dough. Cover and let rise for 50-60 minutes.

title: Orange Truffle Torte
description: For the cake, separate the eggs. Beat the egg whites until stiff with half the sugar. Beat the yolks for 10 minutes until creamy with the remaining sugar, vanilla and water. Mix the flour with cornstarch, baking powder and cocoa. Fold the egg whites into the yolk mixture. Sift the flour mixture over the top and fold in with a whisk. Line a springform pan (26 cm in diameter)​ (approximately 10 inches) with parchment paper. Pour in the batter and smooth. Bake in a preheated oven at 175°C (approximately 350°F) (gas mark 2-3, fan: 160 degrees) for about 30 minutes. Allow to cool for 10 minutes in the pan, then release from the pan and leave to cool on a wire rack.

title: Baked Apples with Nut Filling and Vanilla Sauce
description: Beat the egg yolks with the sugar in a bowl until creamy. Gradually whisk the hot cream into the egg yolk mixture, then pour everything back into the pot and beat over low heat until thickened. Do not boil.

title: Chocolate Crepes with Vanilla Cream
description: For the vanilla cream: Strain the quark through a fine mesh sieve. Separate the egg and beat the egg white until stiff. Beat the egg yolk with the powdered sugar and vanilla sugar. Stir the vanilla pudding powder into the quark and mix until smooth. Stir the egg yolk mixture into the quark mixture, then fold in the egg whites.

title: Buttermilk Cream
description: When the cream starts to gel, beat the heavy cream until stiff and fold into the mixture. Cover and chill for 3-4 hours. Rinse the raspberries and pat dry. Serve the cream with raspberries and mint.

title: Apricot Cream in Chocolate Cups
description: Lay the strips of acetate film on a work surface, leaving some space between the strips. Spread evenly with a thin layer of chocolate, about 2 mm (1/16 inch) thick. Let the chocolate firm for about 10 minutes. Then lift the strip carefully and bend into a teardrop shape with the chocolate side inward. Pinch the ends together and secure with paper clips. Set the teardrop put on lined baking sheet and let the chocolate finishing firming completely in a cool place.

title: Rhubarb Compote with Meringue Topping
description: Beat the egg whites until very stiff with the powdered sugar  and stir in the lemon zest.

title: Crepes with Berry Filling
description: Stir the batter well. Add milk, if necessary, to thin out the batter.

title: Chocolate Cake with Chocolate Icing
description: In a bowl, whisk together the eggs, grated chocolate, salt, custard powder, baking soda and flour and beat into the butter mixture until smooth. Fold in the ground almonds.

title: Chocolate Bombe with Apricots
description: Line an 18 cm (approximately 7-inch) diameter round bowl with plastic wrap and pour in the chocolate mixture. Freeze for 3 to 4 hours. Slice the apricots. Unmold the chocolate bombe onto a plate and remove the plastic wrap. Melt chocolate again and drizzle over the top. Serve garnished with apricots and lemon balm.

title: Blackberry Layer Cake
description: Thaw the blackberries and drain on a sieve. Beat the egg yolk with the honey and vanilla sugar until fluffy. Stir in the mascarpone and cinnamon. Whip the cream and sprinkle in the whipped cream stabilizer. Mix the cream into the mascarpone cream. Set aside 1/3 of blackberries and stir the remaining 2/3 into the cream. Cut the cake twice horizontally to create 3 layers. Warm the blackberries and sprinkle the lower and middle layers with jam.

title: Apricot Parfait with Raspberry Sauce and Strawberries
description: Beat the egg yolks in a bowl until foamy, then, while continuing to whisk, add the lemon syrup in a thin stream. Stir in the apricot puree. Beat the whipping cream until stiff and fold into the egg mixture. Place the mixture in serving ramekins (each about 125-150 ml (approximately 1/2 to 2/3 cup)). Freeze for 3 to 4 hours.

title: Puff Pastry Slices with Blueberries
description: For the blueberry filling, soak the gelatin in cold water. Rinse blueberries and pat dry. Puree yogurt with sugar, half lemon juice and 5 ounces of the blueberries. Remove two tablespoons and place in a small saucepan. Squeeze out the gelatin and add to the yogurt mixture in the saucepan. Stir until dissolved over low heat. Quickly stir into the remaining yogurt mixture. Beat the cream until stiff and fold in. Refrigerate until gelled.

title: Orange Mousse
description: Cut peel off orange peel, removing white skin. Cut out orange segments from the membranes. Dissolve marmalade over low heat, stir in Cointreau and divide among 4 dessert plates. Scoop the mousse with 2 tablespoons place on the dessert plates. Heat butter in a pan, add almonds and brown sugar, cook briefly and serve over the mousse.

title: Brown Biscuits with Almonds
description: Blanch almonds briefly in boiling water and dry. Cut almonds in half.

title: Cake with Apricot and Rice Filling
description: Refrigerate the dough in the pan. Cover and refrigerate the remaining dough. Drain the apricots in a sieve. Toast the almonds briefly in a dry pan, then pour out onto a plate. Separate the eggs. Beat the egg whites. Beat the butter, honey, egg yolks and liqueur until creamy. Stir in the almonds and the rice.

title: Peach Fish
description: For the peaches: Drain peaches well in a sieve. Place a peach half in the middle of each fish.

title: Tea Granita
description: Remove mint from tea and pour into a shallow metal tray. Freeze 6-8 hours, stirring with a fork after about 2 hours to prevent large ice crystals from forming. Thereafter, stir mixture every hour.

title: Rich Chocolate Cake with Sweet Creme Fraiche
description: Melt chocolate over a hot-water bath and brush thinly onto a plate. Let chocolate dry and scrape into thin curls with a spatula. Cut cake into pieces, sprinkle with chocolate curls and dust with powdered sugar. Mix remaining sugar and vanilla sugar into crème fraîche and dollop onto plates with the cake to serve.

title: Chocolate Rice Bars
description: Separate the eggs. Whip the egg whites with salt and lemon juice until stiff. Beat the egg yolks with butter and sugar until fluffy, stir in the rice and fold in the beaten egg whites. Spread half of the batter on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper into a rectangle about 20 x 30 cm (approximately 8 x 12 inches).

title: Glazed Jelly Roll Cake with Mascarpone Cherry Cream
description: Spread in an even layer on a jelly roll pan lined with parchment paper. Bake in an oven preheated to 200°C (approximately 400°F) until golden brown, about 10 minutes.

title: Almond Meringue Layer Cake
description: For the batter: Separate eggs. Beat yolks, sugar and almond liqueur until fluffy. Beat egg whites and salt until stiff. Combine cornstarch and flour. Alternate adding egg whites and flour mixture to yolks. Grease a springform pan with butter and dust with flour. Pour batter into pan and bake in an oven preheated to 180°C (approximately 350°F) on the bottom rack for 25-30 minutes.

title: Preiselbeeräpfel
description: Butter a baking dish and place the apples in it.

title: Chocolate Cream Truffle
description: Peel the pears, remove seeds and cut into eighths. Boil the white wine with cinnamon stick in a small pan. Add the pears and cook for 5 minutes. Draw the pan from heat and allow to cool.

title: Coconut Cream with Poached Kumquats
description: Beat the whipping cream until stiff and fold into the cooled cream along with the shredded coconut and lime zest. Spread the coconut cream into a square baking dish lined with parchment paper and place a piece of plastic wrap on top to prevent a film from forming. Refrigerate for 3-4 hours.

title: Mango and Strawberry Salad with Pistachio Cream Cheese
description: Peel the mango, cut the flesh from the pit and cut into thin strips. Rinse and slice the strawberries. Arrange the mango and strawberries in a serving bowl and drizzle with orange juice.

title: Tiramisu Cake with Chocolate Curls
description: For the filling, beat the egg yolks with sugar, vanilla sugar and salt in a bowl. Place over a hot water bath and beat until creamy. Set the bowl over a cold water bath and beat until chilled. Stir in the mascarpone. Cut the cake twice horizontally, forming 3 layers. Set the bottom layer on a plate. Stir the coffee with the brandy. Soak the cake with 1/3 of the coffee mixture. Spread 2-3 tablespoons of the filling on the cake. Set the middle layer on top, soak with coffee and spread with 2-3 tablespoons of filling. Place the top layer and press gently.

title: Cinnamon Gingerbread Parfait
description: Brush the gingerbread with amaretto. Whip the cream until stiff and fold into the cinnamon custard. Line a loaf pan with plastic wrap.
types: ['Dessert', 'What to Cook on the Weekend?', 'German', 'Meal for Four', 'Guest', 'Birthday', 'Sweet', 'weekend cooking', 'Beverage', 'with Alcohol', 'Eggs', 'Spices', 'Dairy', 'Fruit', 'Snack']

title: Pastry Custard Torte with Redcurrants
description: For the custard, cook vanilla pudding powder according to package directions with milk and sugar and let cool while stirring. For the topping, rinse currants, strip berries from stems with a fork and mix with powdered sugar.

title: Mascarpone Ice Cream with Rhubarb Compote
description: For the rhubarb compote: Rinse the rhubarb and cut into bite-sized pieces. Combine the red currant juice and jam sugar in a small saucepan and simmer for 3-4 minutes. Add the rhubarb and continue simmering for 3-4 minutes, until the rhubarb has softened. Remove from heat and let cool. Toast the pine nuts in a dry pan until golden brown. Scoop the mascarpone ice cream into small bowls, top with the rhubarb compote and garnish with kiwi slices and lemon balm.

title: Apricot and Almond Cream
description: Place almonds into a porcelain bowl, cover with boiling water and let stand briefly. Peel well.

title: Red Currant Cheesecake
description: Line bottom of a springform pan 26 cm diameter (approximately 10 inches diameter) with parchment paper. Roll out dough on a floured surface. Set dough in bottom of prepared pan and pull up an edge about 5 cm high (approximately 2 inches high).

title: Yogurt Parfait with Orange and Strawberry
description: Peel all oranges and remove the pith and membranes with a sharp knife. Without squeezing oranges, collect the residual juice. Rinse strawberries and puree with an immersion blender.
types: ['Cream', 'Low-fat Dessert', 'Gluten-free Snack', 'Gluten-free Dessert', '100-250 Calorie', 'lacto-vegetarian', 'Light Cooking', 'non-alcoholic', 'egg-free', 'Vegetarian', 'Vegetarian Dessert', 'Low-sugar', 'Spring', 'Summer', '20-Minute', 'In a jar', 'date night', 'Easy', 'Meal for Four', 'Garden Party', 'Guest', 'Picnic', 'Sweet', 'Quick', 'weekend cooking', 'Spices', 'Dairy', 'Fruit', 'Brunch', 'Breakfast', 'Sweet Breakfast', 'Snack', 'Dessert', 'Strawberry cream', 'Strawberry Dessert', 'easy dessert', 'Fruit Dessert']

title: Fruit Salad
description: Halve the melon, scrape out the seeds and remove the flesh with a melon baller. Add the melon balls to the bowl.
types: ['Fruit Salad', 'Fruit', 'salad', 'Brunch', 'Breakfast', 'Lunch', 'Dinner', 'Appetizer', 'Dessert', 'Fruit Dessert', 'Buffet', 'Easy', 'Exotic', 'everyday meal', 'crowdpleaser', 'Garden Party', 'Guest', 'Country Style', 'Picnic', 'Sweet', 'Quick', 'weekend cooking', '250-400 Calorie', 'Vegetarian', 'Spring', 'Summer']

title: Poppy Seed Fig Cake
description: Meanwhile combine the wine with the star anise, grated orange zest and sugar in a saucepan and bring to a boil. Soak the gelatin in cold water. Slice figs. Poach the figs for about 1 minute in the red wine mixture. Remove the figs and star anise with a slotted spoon and let cool. Mix the vanilla pudding powder with 6 tablespoons of cold water and stir into the red wine mixture. Bring to a boil. Set aside and add the squeezed gelatine.

title: Sweet Poppy Rolls
description: Meanwhile, prepare the vanilla sauce. Mix 3 tablespoons milk with the pudding powder. Bring the remaining milk to a boil with sugar and vanilla sugar. Stir in the pudding mixture and bring to a boil. Pour into a bowl and set over an ice water bath. Stir until chilled. Drain the apricots and cut into slices.

title: Chocolate Caramel Cream Torte with Hazelnuts
description: For the caramel hazelnuts, toast hazelnuts in a dry nonstick pan until golden brown. Mix sugar and water in a saucepan, caramelize while stirring, let cool slightly and stir in hazelnuts. Spread caramel hazelnuts on parchment paper and separate as necessary. Let caramel hazelnuts cool and chop into small pieces.

title: Spiral Fruit and Cream Torte
description: For the cake, separate eggs and beat whites until stiff. Beat egg yolks, sugar and vanilla sugar until fluffy and fold in egg whites. Mix flour and baking soda, sift over egg mixture and fold in with a whisk. Smoothly spread batter on a baking tray lined with parchment paper. Bake cake in oven preheated to 200°C (fan: 180°C, gas mark 3-4)(approximately 400°F) for 8-10 minutes. Immediately invert pan to remove cake to a piece of parchment paper sprinkled with sugar and let cool. Cover cake with a damp towel.

title: Riesling Tart with Cream
description: For the filling, mix cinnamon and sugar and sprinkle over crust alternately with flour. Cut butter into cubes and distribute over crust. Pour wine over butter in crust. Bake tart in oven preheated to 200°C (fan: 180°C, gas mark 3-4)(approximately 400°F) for about 40 minutes. Let tart cool on a wire rack.

title: Creamy Peach Crumble Cake
description: For the topping: Whisk quark with whipped cream, eggs, sugar and vanilla sugar. Spread cream on the pastry. Spread cream with remaining pastry crumbs. Place cherry jam into a freezer bag and cut off a corner. Pipe jam in circles on top of cake and place peach halves in the middle of each circle. Pipe remaining jam into the middle of peach halves. Bake cake for 30-40 minutes. Whisk apricot jam  with 1-2 tablespoons of water, bring to a boil and strain through a sieve. Brush peaches with the mixture and serve.

title: Toffee Cream Bars
description: For the topping, mix the pudding powder according to package directions using 400 ml (approximately 1 1/2 cup) of whipped cream and 200 ml (approximately 3/4 cup) of milk. Refrigerate for 10 minutes, then pour 4 tablespoons into a piping bag with an 8 mm (approximately 1/4 inch) diameter tip. Chop the toffees and stir into the remaining pudding. Spread the mixture on the cake. Pipe 12 small spirals on the cake and chill for two hours. Cut the cake into pieces, garnish with toffees and serve.

title: Glazed Apricot Wreaths
description: Roll out the dough thinly on lightly floured surface. Cut out 10 circles, 10 cm (approximately 4 inches) in diameter and place on a lined baking sheet. Knead the remaining dough and cut into 10 pieces. Form each piece of dough into a 50 cm (approximately 20 inch) long roll. Fold in half and twist to form a cord. Brush the edges of the dough circles with a little water, place a piece of the cord around each and press gently. Beat the pudding briefly with the whisk of the hand mixer.

title: Layered Mango Grape Torte
description: Bake cake in oven preheated to 180°C (fan: 160°C, gas mark 2-3)(approximately 350°F) for 10-12 minutes. Invert pan to remove cake to a tea towel sprinkled with sugar. Remove parchment paper from cake and let cool. Repeat with remaining cake ingredients to bake a second cake. From the cakes, cut out two large squares 28 x 28 cm (approximately 11 x 11 inches) and two small squares 14 x 14 cm (approximately 5 1/2 x 5 1/2 inches).

title: Spiced Almond Cake Squares
description: For the filling, mix all the ingredients. Roll out half of the dough and place on a greased baking sheet. Roll out the marzipan between two sheets of plastic wrap to the size of the baking sheet and place it on the sheet of dough.
types: ['Cookie', 'pastry', 'spiced shortcrust biscuit', 'pastry', 'Dough', 'Advent', 'Christmas', 'Christmas pastry', 'Christmas Cookie', 'Christmas Cookie', 'Cooking on vacation', 'crowdpleaser', 'Guest', 'Sweet', 'weekend cooking', 'Snack', 'Nibbles', 'Dessert']

title: Chocolate Raisin Shortbread
description: Divide dough into 2 portions then shape each into a 30 cm (approximately 12-inch) log. Square off the sides to make a large rectangle, wrap in plastic wrap and chill for at least 5 hours. Cut into 0.5 cm (approximately 1/4 inch) thick slices and arrange on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper. Bake in a preheated oven at 150°C (approximately 300°F) for 15 minutes. Let the cookies cool on a wire rack.

title: Walnut Brittle Pretzel Cookies
description: For the cookie dough: Combine all ingredients and knead until smooth. Wrap in plastic wrap and chill for 30 minutes. Turn the dough out onto a lightly floured work surface and roll out until 2-3 mm (approximately 1/8-inch) thick. Cut into pretzel-shaped cookies and arrange on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper. For the egg wash: Whisk the egg yolks and milk together then brush over the cookies.

title: Spiced Rye Cake
description: Combine the flour, baking powder and spices, add to the syrup mixture and knead with the dough hook attachment until smooth. Grease and flour a 25 x 11 cm (approximately 10 x 4 inch) loaf pan, fill with the batter, smooth the surface and sprinkle with the rock candy.

title: Swedish Cardamom Star Cookies
description: On a floured work surface, roll out the dough until about 7 mm (approximately 1/4 inch) thick and cut out 5 cm (approximately 2-inch) stars. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper and arrange the cookies on the baking sheet. Cover and let dry overnight. The following day, bake the cookies in a preheated oven (130°C) (approximately 275°F) for 30 minutes.

title: Spelt and Hazelnut Christmas Tree Cookies
description: Chop all ingredients together until crumbly then knead until smooth. Roll out thinly on a lightly floured work surface and cut out 7 cm (approximately 2 3/4 inch) fir trees. Arrange on baking sheets lined with parchment paper.

title: Coffee Brownies
description: Wrap the baking sheet with foil around the edges to prevent any spillage and bake in a preheated oven (180°C) (approximately 350°F) for 25 minutes.

title: Berry Soup with Mernigue
description: Rinse and sort the raspberries. Puree 200 grams of the raspberries and strain through a sieve into a saucepan. Add the currant juice, sugar and vanilla sugar and bring to a boil. Stir the cornstarch with a little cold water until smooth. Stir into the juice and bring to a boil again. Rinse the strawberries and into pieces. Pour all the berries into the juice, heat briefly, then refrigerate.
types: ['soup', 'Juice', 'Fruit Juice', 'Cooking', 'Fruit', 'chilled soup', 'Lunch', 'Dinner', 'Appetizer', 'Dessert', 'Fruit Dessert', 'Meal for Four', 'Summer', 'Summer soup']

title: Profiteroles with Raspberry Cream
description: Soak the gelatin for about 5 minutes in cold water. Coarsely mash the raspberries with a fork. Melt the dripping wet gelatin in a small saucepan over medium heat. Stir in the raspberries and cool until the mixture starts to gel.

title: East Frisian Tea Cookies
description: Add the sugar and flour to the solidified butter and process until crumbly with the dough hook of the hand mixer. Knead with hands to a smooth dough. Wrap the dough in plastic wrap and chill for about 30 minutes in the refrigerator.

title: Pine Nut and Almond Cookies
description: Cut the almonds in half lengthwise. Spread the wafers on the baking sheets. Divide the dough into cherry-sized balls and put each ball on a wafer. Press an almond half in the middle of each dough ball. Bake in a preheated oven at 180°C (fan: 160°C, gas mark 2-3) (approximately 350°F) for about 15 minutes.

title: Mint Chocolate Cream
description: Beat the whipping cream with the vanilla sugar until stiff, then stir in the instant gelatin. Fold the whipped cream into the slightly cooled chocolate mixture and refrigerate for 1 hour.

title: Carrot Oatmeal Muffins
description: Beat the butter, sugar, eggs and salt until creamy. Mix the flour and baking powder. Gradually stir the flour mixture, oats and milk into the batter. Fold in the grated carrot.

title: Berry Salad
description: Set aside and let infuse for 10 minutes. Whip the cream. Garnish the berry salad with the whipped cream and the mint. Serve the salad with biscuits, if you'd like.

title: Fruit Sundae with Semolina Pudding
description: Split the vanilla bean lengthwise, scrape out the seeds and place in a saucepan with the vanilla bean  and the milk and bring to a boil.  Whisk in the semolina and cook until smooth, remove from heat. In a bowl, beat the egg yolks and sugar until creamy. Gradually add the warm milk mixture to the egg yolk mixture then pour the mixture back into the pot and remove the vanilla bean. Cook, over low heat, stirring all the while until the custard is thick enough to coat the back of a spoon. Do not boil. Pour the semolina custard over the fruit and cool. Serve garnished with mint.

title: Triple Chocolate Mousse Cake
description: For the dough, mix softened butter with sugar and vanilla until foamy. Stir in eggs one at a time and then add baking powder. Place in bottom of a springform pan lined with parchment paper and bake in a preheated oven at 160°C (approximately 325°F) for 50-60 minutes. Cool slightly, release from pan and cool completely on a wire rack.
types: ['Chocolate Cake', 'Cake', 'Layer Cake', 'tart', 'European', 'Winter Cake', 'Valentine's Day', 'Christmas', 'What to Cook on the Weekend?', 'Sweet', 'Dessert']

title: Peanut Cake
description: Cut cooled cake into four layers. Spread three layers with cream and place on top of each other. Top cake with the remaining layer. Spread cream on the sides of the cake and refrigerate for at least 2 hours.

title: Strawberry Shake
description: Pour the strawberry syrup into four glasses and then add the strawberry mixture. Top with a scoop of ice cream, garnish with mint leaves and chopped pistachios and serve immediately.

title: Strawberry Parfait
description: Trim the strawberries and mix with sugar and remaining lemon juice.

title: Blackberry Fool
description: With a hand mixer, beat creme fraiche a few minutes. Stir in blackberry puree, Kirsch and honey. Whip cream to stiff peaks and fold into blackberry mixture. Divide blackberry fool among glasses and refrigerate until set, about 1 hour. Garnish with blackberries and lemon balm and serve dusted with powdered sugar.

title: Raspberry and Yogurt Smoothie
description: Immediately pour into bowls or glasses. Serve with agave to taste and garnish with raspberries and herbs as desired.

title: Heart-Shaped Cherry Tarte Tatin
description: Butter heart cake pan with remaining butter. Rinse and dry cherries, pit and arrange in a pan. Squeeze lemon juice and drizzle cherries with approximately 2 tablespoons of juice, sprinkle with remaining lemon zest. Spread batter over cherries and bake in preheated oven at 180°C (approximately 350°F) for about 40 minutes. Cool slightly, invert onto a plate and sprinkle with powdered sugar. Serve.
types: ['tart', 'Flan', 'cherry tart', 'European', 'French', 'Summer Cake', 'Valentine's Day', 'Cooking on vacation', 'Fruit', 'Stone Fruit', 'Dessert']

title: Peach Cream with Berries
description: Whip cream with cream stabilizer and remaining powdered sugar until stiff. Fold half of whipped cream into peach puree and divide among dessert glasses. Top with remaining whipped cream. Garnish with berries and lemon balm.

title: Chocolate Souffle
description: For the souffle: melt chopped chocolate in a metal bowl over hot water bath, then add butter. Whisk egg yolks and add to chocolate. Beat egg whites and sugar until stiff and fold into the mixture. Pour batter into the forms (up to 3/4) and bake in prehearted oven at 180°C (approximately 350°F) for about 15-20 minutes. Place souffle onto plates, garnish with mint and serve with banana and pear sauce.

title: Baked Dough Sheets with Strawberry Filling
description: Remove and let cool.

title: Melon Skewers with Berry Sauce
description: Using a melon baller, scoop out enough of the melon for several balls. Cut the rest of the melon into bite-sized cubes and triangles. Arrange the fruit decoratively on skewers, then drizzle with lemon juice. Serve the skewers with the berry sauce.

title: Mango Peach Pineapple Cream Torte
description: Let cake cool in pan for about 10 minutes. Carefully invert pan to remove cake onto a wire rack lined with parchment paper. Remove parchment paper from cake and let cool. Cut cake horizontally into two layers and cut top layer into 16 wedges. Set bottom cake layer on a serving plate. Set a cake ring around bottom cake layer.

title: Chocolate Cake with Cranberries
description: Whip butter or margarine until creamy. Gradually add sugar, vanilla sugar, espresso powder and egg. Stir in melted couverture. Mix flour with baking powder and stir, then add hazelnuts, cocoa, amaretto and orange peel. Fold in cranberries.

title: Prosciutto-Wrapped Figs with Ricotta and Nut Filling
description: Chop the walnuts and mix with the ricotta and sugar. Cut the figs crosswise and fill with the ricotta. Cut the slices of prosciutto in half and wrap each fig.

title: Berry Sorbet
description: Set the bowl on a hot water bath.

title: White Chocolate Ice Cream Cake with Raspberries
description: Puree the raspberries with 100 grams (approximately 2/3 cup) powdered sugar and pass through a fine-mesh sieve. Rinse the remaining raspberries. Remove the tart pan from the freezer, briefly dip in hot water and then transfer to a serving plate. Whip the remaining cream with the vanilla bean seeds and 1 teaspoon powdered sugar until stiff, spread over the ice cream cake, top with raspberries and dust with remaining powdered sugar. Serve with the raspberry puree.

title: Strawberry and Rhubarb Compote with Vanilla Ice Cream
description: If you don't have an ice cream maker, you can put the mixture into a shallow metal tray, and place in the freezer for at least 5 hours. Stir after the first hour. Peel the rhubarb for the compote, trim, and cut into bite-sized pieces. Rinse, trim, and quarter the strawberries. bring the fruit, sugar, lemon juice, and orange liqueur to a boil in a saucepan. Reduce the heat and simmer for 5-8 minutes. Remove from the heat, and serve warm or cold with the ice cream.

title: Almond Rice Pudding with Cherries
description: For the compote: rinse and pit cherries. Combine cornstarch with 2-3 tablespoons of juice, mix until smooth. Boil remaining juice with sugar and lemon juice. Add cherries and simmer for about 5 minutes. Add cornstarch and cook unitl it thickens. Remove from heat and let cool.

title: Fried Couscous with Apples
description: Rinse, peel and cut the apples into slices. Heat 2 tablespoons of butter in a pan. Add the sugar until slightly caramelized. Add the apple slices and saute for about 3 minutes until light brown.

title: Layered Hazelnut and Marble Birthday Cake
description: For the marble cake, beat margarine until creamy and gradually stir in sugar, vanilla sugar and eggs. Mix flour and baking powder, sift over batter and quickly fold in with a whisk. Remove about 3 tablespoons batter and stir in cocoa. Line a baking pan with parchment paper. Smoothly spread plain dough in prepared pan. Dollop chocolate batter onto plain batter. Drag through batters with a fork to create a marble pattern. Bake marble cake in oven preheated to 180°C (approximately 350°F) for about 30 minutes. Loosen cake from pan and let cool.
