title: Baked Apples
description: Melt the butter in a saucepan. Add the sugar, nuts and milk. Let simmer. Spread over the apples and bake for about 20 minutes. Remove the jars from the oven and seal immediately.

title: Flummery with Yogurt, Oatmeal and Strawberries
description: Rinse the strawberries and place 4 berries to the side. Trim the remaining berries, chop and spoon into 4 bowls.

title: German Christmas Crescent Cookies
description: Divide the dough into 3 portions. Knead the cocoa powder, vanilla bean seeds and 1/2 of the mocha into separate portions. Cover the portions in plastic wrap and let rest for about 30 minutes.

title: Brownies
description: Preheat the oven to 180°C (approximately 350°F). Line a 20 x 30 cm (approximately 8 x 12 inch) deep baking pan with parchment paper.

title: Grilled Tofu and Fruit Kababs
description: Free the pineapple from the hard shell and chop the flesh into cubes. Peel the banana and cut into slices. Drizzle with lime juice.

title: Grilled Apples
description: Cook the apples on a hot grill with the lid closed for 15 minutes.

title: Strawberry Sauce
description: To serve, run under hot water to loosen and place on a plate

title: Rhubarb Compote with Strawberries
description: Caramelize 2 tablespoons sugar in a saucepan and pour in the apple and lemon juice. Add the rhubarb, cinnamon and the halved vanilla bean and simmer gently for 2-3 minutes. Mix in the strawberries and cook 1 more minute. Remove from the heat, add the raspberries and let cool. Remove the cinnamon and the vanilla.

title: Grilled Fruit Skewers with Fig and Mango
description: Mix together the honey, lime juice, and cinnamon. Drizzle the skewers with the lime-honey mixture.

title: Yogurt Cream with Melon
description: Remove seeds from melon and puree with lime juice, remaining vanilla bean seeds and 1 tablespoon sugar. If desired, sweeten with additional sugar. Divide puree over yogurt cream and garnish with raspberries and mint.

title: Almond and Milk Chocolate Haystacks
description: Chop the chocolate coarsely and melt with the coconut oil in a bowl set over a hot water bath. Stir in the almonds. Spoon teaspoonfuls of the mixture onto parchment paper and let the clusters harden.

title: Layered Red Currant Dessert
description: Soften gelatine in cold water. Combine 350 grams (approximately 1 1/2 cup) of berries with about 80 ml (approximately (1/3 cup) of water and cook until berries are softened. Strain through a fine sieve. Squeeze gelatine and dissolve in hot pureed berries. Add 50 grams (approximately 1/5 cup) of sugar and refrigerate berry mixture until it thickens.

title: Strawberry Ice Cream Souffle
description: Out of parchment paper, make souffle cups (the easiest way is to cut strips and arrange them around actual souffle cup and secure with kitchen twine).

title: Blueberry Cream
description: Mix the blueberries (saving a few) with the cream and fold into the mascarpone cream. Spread the cream between glasses. Serve garnished with the remaining berries, orange zest and mint leaves.

title: Cherry Almond Smoothie
description: Peel the banana and puree. Add the kefir, almond butter, and honey.

title: Red Fruit Jelly with Whipped Cream
description: Press through a fine sieve into a new pot. Add in the sugar and vanilla sugar and bring to a boil. Stir the cornstarch with a little cold water until smooth. Sitr into the fruit. Bring to a boil while stirring and let then remove from heat and let cool.

title: Frozen Vanilla Parfaits with Caramel Sauce and Strawberries
description: For the topping: Heat the brown sugar in a small saucepan until melted and bubbly. Remove from heat and stir in the orange juice and butter. Set over low heat to keep warm.

title: Cream with Vanilla Caramel Sauce
description: Place bowl over a cold water bath and stir until cold. Refrigerate until cold but just before mixture completely sets. Whip remaining cream until stiff and fold into mixture. Distribute into small ramekins and refrigerate for 2-3 hours.

title: Orange Filled Cookies
description: Mix the flour with the sugar, vanilla, and orange zest in a bowl. Add the eggs, butter, orange liqueur and 1 tablespoon of cold water. Chop through with a knife until crumbly. Knead quickly by hand until smooth. Knead in the Cointreau.

title: Currant Sheet Cake
description: For the filling, scald the milk with half the sugar and vanilla. Slowly add the semolina while stirring and cook 1 minute. Separate the egg. Stir the yolk into the semolina mixture. Beat egg white until stiff and fold into the semolina mixture. Let cool, stirring occasionally. Stir the crème fraîche into the semolina mixture.

title: Caramel Cream with Tropical Fruit
description: For the garnish: Moisten the rim of the serving glasses with lime juice and then turn the edges in sugar.

title: Chocolate Ice Cream with Rum Sabayon
description: Mix 6 egg yolks with 100 grams (approximately 1/2 cup) of sugar in a bowl and beat for 5 minutes until creamy. Pour in milk and cream and beat for another 5 minutes. Stir in melted chocolate. Freeze in an ice cream machine according to manufacturer instructions or for 6–8 hours in the freezer, stirring often.

title: Yeast Dumplings with Chocolate
description: Chop chocolate coarsely. In a small saucepan, bring cream and remaining milk to a boil, take pan off heat and melt dark chocolate while stirring. Coarsely chop walnuts.

title: Prune Tarts
description: For the batter, beat butter until creamy and gradually stir in powdered sugar, vanilla sugar and eggs. Mix flour with baking powder and stir into batter mixture. Stir prune mixture into batter.

title: Muesli Bread
description: Knead dough briefly and divide into 2 portions. Roll into logs about 5 cm (approximately 2.5 inches) thick and slightly squeeze the ends. Place on a lined baking tray and top with remaining muesli. Cover and let sit about 15 minutes in a warm place. Bake in preheated oven at 200°C (approximately 400°F) about 25 minutes.

title: Yeast Dough Dumpling
description: For the yeast dumplings: Mix flour and cornflour in a bowl and make a well in the center. Heat milk until lukewarm and pour into the flour well. Crumble yeast and add 1 teaspoon sugar. Mix milk with flour to a paste. Let rest 10-15 minutes in a warm place. Melt the butter. Add to the flour together with remaining sugar, salt and eggs and knead with the kneading hook of a hand mixer until smooth.

title: Rhubarb Charlotte
description: Soak gelatin in cold water for 5 minutes. Rinse and core strawberries. Puree 200 grams (approximately 7 ounces) of strawberries. Quarter remaining strawberries.

title: Fruit Salad in Papaya Halves
description: Mix honey and passion fruit juice, season with a pinch of salt and nutmeg and toss with fruit mixture. Serve fruit mixture in papaya halves.

title: Fried Apple Slices over Custard
description: For the apple slices, rinse apples and core. Cut apples into slices. Heat oil in a pan. Sauté apples and sprinkle with vanilla sugar when nearly cooked. Serve custard together with apples and garnish with lemon balm.

title: Cinnamon Cranberry Baked Apple on Vanilla Rice
description: Rinse apples, cut out cores with an apple corer, being careful not to puncture outer walls. Fill with cranberries and insert one cinnamon stick into cranberry filling. Tip: Wrap top of cinnamon stick with a small piece of aluminum foil to prevent scorching.

title: Lamb Cookies with Chocolate Icing and Coconut Sprinkles
description: On a floured surface, roll out dough in a thin layer, about 3 mm (approximately 1/8  inch). Cut out lamb shapes with a cookie cutter. Place on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper. Bake in preheated oven at 200°C (fan: 180°C, gas mark 3-4) (approximately 400°F) for about 12 minutes. Cool cookies on a wire rack.

title: Savarins with Fresh Strawberries
description: Grease 4 ramekins, each about 150 ml (approximately 1/2 cup) and lightly dust with flour. Put dough into a piping bag and pipe into ramekins. Let sit again for 15 minutes.

title: Streusel Strawberry Bars
description: For the streusel: Crumble the butter, sugar, lemon peel, vanilla sugar, and flour until crumbly. Chill for 30 minutes. Rinse the strawberries and cut into pieces.

title: Rhubarb Granita with Strawberry Salad
description: Place the dish in the freezer and freeze for about 4 hours, stirring about every half an hour. The more the granita is stirred, the finer it will be.

title: Marble Cake with Chocolate Kisses
description: Divide batter in half. Stir pudding mix into half of the batter and cocoa into remaining half. Sprinkle a greased 25 cm (approximately 9-inch) square baking pan with breadcrumbs. Drop batters by spoonfuls into the pan then swirl a fork through the batter to create a marble pattern. Bake in preheated 175°C (approximately 350°F) oven for 40 minutes. Cool the cake in the pan on a wire rack.

title: Rich Chocolate Cake with Truffle Filling
description: Spoon batter into a greased 26 cm (approximately 10-inch) diameter springform pan and smooth the top. Bake in preheated 175°C (approximately 350°F) oven for 1 hour. Cover loosely with foil during the last 15 minutes. Cool cake in the pan.

title: Almond Cinnamon Cookies
description: On a floured surface, cut out 3-4 cm (approximately 1 1/4-1 1/2 inch) diameter circles with a scallop-edged cookie cutter. Place on a parchment-lined baking sheet.

title: Christmas Brownies
description: Line a shallow, rectangular baking pan (about 22x28 cm, approximately 9x11 inches) with parchment paper. Pour in the batter and smooth. Bake in a preheated oven at 175°C (gas mark 2-3, fan: 160°C) (approximately 350°F) for 35-40 minutes. Remove from the oven, cover with parchment paper and let cool.

title: Ginger Cookies
description: Put cherry-sized heaps of batter onto a parchment-lined baking try using a teaspoon, leaving plenty of space between them. Bake in a preheated oven at 200°C (approximately 400°F) for 8 minutes. While hot, loosely fold the cookies in half. Bake again until hard.

title: Mandarin Orange and Eggnog Cream Cake
description: For the topping, soak gelatin in a bowl of cold water for about 5 minutes. Mix quark, eggnog liqueur and sugar. Drain mandarin oranges in a colander over a bowl and collect juice. In a saucepan, heat 4 tablespoons mandarin orange juice, then add gelatine and stir until dissolved. Remove from heat. Stir 2-3 tablespoons quark mixture into juice mixture, then stir in remaining quark mixture. Refrigerate briefly until mixture starts to gel, about 10-15 minutes.

title: Ginger Rice with Caramel Pears
description: For the caramel pears, rinse pears and cut into slices. Drizzle with lemon juice. Caramelize sugar until golden brown in a large skillet. Add pear slices and briefly coat. Don't allow caramel to darken too much. Reduce heat or remove from heat if needed. Place pear slices on parchment paper to drive. Serve ginger rice with pear slices.

title: Gingerbread Almond Cookies with Chocolate Drizzle
description: Dissolve potash (or 1/8 teaspoon baking soda) in water. Add potash, egg and flour to honey mixture and mix until dough is smooth. Cover dough and refrigerate overnight.

title: Nut and Cream Cookies
description: Roll out the dough into a rectangle (about 28 x 24 cm) (approximately 11 x 10 inches) on a large piece of parchment paper. Prick the dough base several times with a fork. Place the rolled dough base along with the parchment paper on a baking sheet and bake in a preheated oven at 200°C (fan: 180°C, gas mark 3) (approximately 400°F) for about 18-20 minutes.

title: Goat Cheese Cream with Baked Apricots
description: Soak gelatine in a bowl of cold water until softened, about 10 minutes. Squeeze the excess moisture from the gelatine. In a bowl, beat the cream with 30 grams (approximately 2 tablespoons) of the powdered sugar until stiff. Stir the gelatine into the goat cheese mixture. Gently fold in the whipped cream. Divide the mixture between 125 ml (approximately 1/2 cup) ramekins. Refrigerate until set, about 4 hours.

title: Crema Catalana
description: Set the bowl over a hot water bath and beat with a whisk until the cream has thickened. Transfer the cream to a shallow dish 13.5 cm (approximately 5 inches) in diameter. Refrigerate overnight. Sprinkle sugar over the top and caramelize the sugar in the broiler for a few minutes, watching carefully.

title: Baked Apricot Pies in Dessert Glasses
description: Cream butter until foamy. Add sugar and stir. Stir in vanilla and eggs slowly. Add sour cream and mix well. Add lemon zest, sifted flour and baking powder. Fold in apricots and pink peppercorns. Fill each glass with batter.
types: ['Baking', 'Cake', 'Cake in a Jar', 'cake or tart with fruit', 'Dough', 'In a jar', 'Dessert in a Jar', 'with Alcohol', 'Course', 'Snack', 'Menu', 'Dessert']

title: Snow Eggs with Vanilla Sauce and Caramel
description: For the snow eggs: In a bowl, beat the egg whites until soft peaks form. Continue beating while adding the sugar 1 spoonful at a time until very stiff and glossy. Use 2 tablespoons to drop oval meringues on a parchment-lined baking sheet. Bake in a 150°C (approximately 300°F)(gas mark 1-2, fan: 130 degrees) oven for 10 minutes.

title: Carrot Cake
description: Bake in an oven preheated to 180°C (approximately 350°F) for about 45 minutes. Remove and let cool for 10 minutes. Release from pan and let cool completely on a wire rack.

title: Chocolate Cake
description: Separate eggs and beat yolks with sugar until fluffy. Gently add chocolate mixture and stir. Sift in flour and stir briefly. Beat egg whites until stiff and fold into batter.

title: Wine Cream Cake
description: For the base, mix ingredients to make a dough. Line bottom of a springform pan measuring 26 cm (approximately 10 inches) in diameter with parchment paper. Pour in dough and bake for 18-20 minutes. Remove from pan and cool on a wire rack.

title: Honeyblossom Cookies
description: Roll out dough between 2 sheets of parchment paper. Cut flower shapes out with a cookie cutter and place on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper. Bake in a preheated oven at 180°C (fan: 160°C, gas mark 2-3) (approximately 350°F) for 8 minutes. Remove and cool.

title: Yogi Tea Cookies
description: Roll dough out until about 2-3 mm (approximately 1/10 inch) thick. Whisk egg yolk with water and brush onto dough. Mix almonds with sesame seeds and Yogi tea. Drizzle over dough. Cut dough into small rectangles measuring 3 x 2.5 cm (approximately 1 x .75 inches) and place on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.

title: Orange Spice Tarts
description: For the filling: Peel and slice orange. Combine orange slices, butter, sugar, vanilla sugar, eggs, cornstarch, cream, aniseed and orange zest and stir until smooth. Divide into 2 tarts and bake in an oven preheated to 220°C (approximately 425°F) for about 30 minutes.

title: Panforte
description: Place the honey and sugar in a saucepan and simmer while stirring for 2-3 minutes. Pour into the nut mixture until combined. Pour into the mold and press into a smooth layer with a damp wooden spoon. Bake in a 150°C (approximately 300°F) oven for 35-40 minutes.

title: Lemon and Cinnamon Flat Pastries (hip)
description: Line a baking sheet with parchment paper. For each pastry, spread a small spoonful of dough with an offset spatula in a circle about 8-9 cm (approximately 3 inches) diameter. Lightly sprinkle dough with almonds. Space pastries about 8 cm (approximately 3 inches) apart. Bake in preheated oven at 180°C (fan: 160°C, gas mark 2-3) (approximately 350°F) until edges are light brown, about 5 minutes. Bake in batches, only 4 circles at at time.

title: Black Cherry Layer Cake
description: Drain cherries. Divide dough into 4 portions. Spread dough into 26 cm (approximately 10 inch) cake rings and place on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper. Top 3 portions of dough with about ¾ of the cherries. Bake dough in an oven preheated to 180°C (approximately 350°F) for 10-12 minutes. Remove and let cool

title: Iced Coconut Meringues
description: Place mixture in a piping bag with decorating tip (about 14 mm)(approximately 1/2 inch). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper. Pipe strips, each about 5-6 cm (approximately 2 inches) long onto baking sheet. Bake in preheated oven at 150°C (fan: 130°C, gas mark 2-3) (approximately 300°F), about 15 minutes. Let cool.

title: Chocolates
description: Mix mixture with the whisk attachment of an electric hand mixer. Pour into a piping bag and pipe small mounds into paper cups. Chill for 1 hour.

title: Chocolate Pear Cakes
description: Coarsely chop chocolate. Heat milk and add chocolate. Beat butter and sugar until fluffy. Add with vanilla sugar and salt. Stir in eggs, one-by-one. Combine flour, cornstarch, cocoa and baking powder. Fold dry ingredients into batter, then add chocolate and walnuts.

title: Coconut and Pineapple Cake
description: For the filling, soak gelatin in cold water. Drain pineapple juice in a sieve, collecting juice. Mix quark with sugar and vanilla. Heat 6 tablespoons pineapple juice and add gelatin. Dissolve. Stir into quark mixture and chill just until mixture begins to set. Whip cream and fold into filling. Add grated coconut and stir.

title: Hazelnut and Apple Cake
description: Mix butter with sugar and eggs well with the whisk of a hand mixer. Stir in yogurt and potatoes. Mix flour with milk powder and baking powder and mix into the batter with the hazelnuts.

title: Apple with Cinnamon Sabayon
description: Whisk egg yolks with 100 ml (approximately 1/2 cup) of broth, remaining sugar and cinnamon in a saucepan. Beat over medium heat until thick.

title: Cream Cheese and Apricot Tart
description: Roll out pastry on lightly floured surface until slightly larger than a baking pan (26 cm in diameter) (approximately 10 inches) and line pan with it, making an edge all around. Bake in preheated oven at 200°C (gas mark 3, fan: 180°C) (approximately 400°F) for about 20-25 minutes. Remove from the oven and cool in a pan for 10 minutes, transfer to a wire rack and cool completely.

title: Raspberries Topped with Meringue
description: Clean raspberries and spread on the cookie crust. Drizzle with raspberry liqueur. Beat egg whites until stiff and gradually add sugar, beating constantly. Spread egg whites onto raspberries with a spoon and bake under a hot broiler until meringue browns lightly, watching carefully. Remove from the oven, cool and serve.

title: Raspberry Charlotte
description: Beat mascarpone, sugar, vanilla sugar and lemon zest. Add mashed raspberries. Stir 2-3 tablespoons of the mixture into the gelatin, then fold into remaining mixture. Chill until mixture starts to gel.

title: Baked Berries with Mascarpone Cream
description: Whisk mascarpone with milk, sugar and vanilla sugar. Add eggs and mix well, then fold in semolina mixed with baking powder.

title: Almond Cream with Raspberries
description: Once mass begins to thicken, beat cream until stiff, and fold in almonds. Pour cream into chilled ramekins (about 150 ml)(approximately 1/2 cup) and chill in refrigerator for 2 1/2 hours.

title: Pistachio-Crusted Poached Pears with Raspberry Sauce
description: Remove the pears and set aside. Bring the white wine syrup to a boil and reduce until syrupy. Brush the pears with the syrup and roll in the pistachios.

title: Orange Chocolate Pinwheels
description: Crumble cookies. Combine cookie crumbs, butter, cocoa, pistachios, sugar, vanilla sugar and cinnamon.

title: Baked Cheese Balls with Pistachios
description: Place dough in a bowl and stir in 1 egg. Let cool slightly. In a separate bowl, mix remaining eggs with dough hook of hand mixer.

title: Chocolate Cream Torte
description: For the cream, soak gelatin in cold water. Mix pudding mix with 6 tablespoons milk. Bring remaining milk and sugar to a boil in a small saucepan. Stir in pudding mixture and return to a boil. Chop 100 grams (approximately 3 1/2 ounces) chocolate finely and stir into the pudding with the cinnamon. Dissolve espresso powder in the rum and stir with the squeezed out gelatin into the pudding. Let cool down. Beat the cream until stiff and fold in. Refrigerate for 10 to15 minutes.

title: Fruit Salad with Mascarpone Cream
description: Rinse and halve grapes.

title: Fruit Salad with Blueberry Sauce
description: Peel the oranges and remove the white skin. Divide the oranges into fillets.

title: Creme Caramel
description: Split vanilla pods and scrape out seeds into a pot with milk. Drop in pod and bring to a boil. Mix eggs and sugar well. Remove pods from milk and gradually add to eggs and sugar mixture, stirring constantly.

title: Black Currant Sorbet in Three Sauces
description: Mix sugar and 5 tablespoons water in a saucepan and simmer gently for about 3 minutes. Beat egg yolks in a bowl and add sugar syrup in a thin stream, beating constantly. Continue beating egg yolk mixture until thickened and creamy.

title: Lime Ice Cream with Citrus Salad
description: For the citrus salad: Peel the grapefruits and oranges making sure to remove all of the white pith. Remove the grapefruit and orange segments with a sharp knife and toss with the Cointreau and chopped pistachios. Let marinate for about 20 minutes. Spoon the citrus salad into dessert bowls, top with a scoop of lime ice cream and serve.

title: Cointreau Marinated Citrus with Pistachio Ice Cream
description: Cut the oranges into thin slices and the grapefruits into segments. Toss the orange and grapefruit with the Cointreau and let marinate for at least 30 minutes.

title: Peaches with Raspberries and Vanilla Ice Cream (Pêche Melba)
description: Blanch peaches in boiling water for 1 minute. Drain and rinse under cold water. Peel peaches, halve and carefully remove the pits. Place the peaches in the sugar syrup and let stand for 30 minutes, stirring occasionally.

title: Mini Brioches
description: Add the butter with eggs and 1 pinch of salt to the flour mixture and knead to a smooth dough. Cover the dough and let rise for another 30 minutes in a warm place.

title: Blood Orange Tartlets
description: When cream begins to gel, beat egg whites with 1 pinch of salt until stiff and fold into the cream.

title: Baked Pancake with Blood Orange Compote
description: For the pancake, soak the raisins in rum. Mix the flour with milk and 1 pinch of salt to a smooth batter. Beat the egg whites with 1 pinch of salt until stiff. Gradually add the egg yolks into the batter, and stir in the rum-soaked raisins. Gently fold the beaten egg whites into the batter.

title: Red Wine Pears with Walnuts
description: Add pears to sauce and simmer gently on low heat for 5-8 minutes on each side. Place pears in a bowl. Pour sauce through a sieve and pour over pears. Marinate everything for at least 24 hours.
types: ['Fruit Dessert', 'Vegan', 'Vegan Dessert for Christmas', 'Vegan Dessert', 'Nut', 'Fruit', 'Pome Fruit', 'Dessert', 'easy dessert']

title: Raspberry Parfait
description: Beat the egg yolks with sugar, vanilla sugar and Cointreau in a bowl over a pan of hot water until frothy. Set the bowl cold water bath. Stir in the mascarpone. Whip the cream until stiff and fold in. Pour into a pan lined with cling (about 500 ml (approximately 2 cups)). Freeze for 4-6 hours.

title: Rice Cream with Baked Apples
description: Soak the gelatin for 5 minutes in cold water. Brew the green tea with boiling water in a pot. Remove the tea bags from the pot and add the rice. Slit the vanilla bean and scrape out the seeds. Add the vanilla seeds and pod to the rice and let simmer for 10 minutes over low heat. Let the rice soak for 25 minutes. Squeeze out the gelatine and mix into the hot rice. Stir in the honey. Let the rice cool down.

title: Rosemary Caramel Pears with Vanilla Ice Cream
description: Place the pear slices and the rosemary on plates. Add orange juice to the pan and mix well. Serve the pears with vanilla ice cream and drizzle with the caramel sauce.

title: Mango Sorbet
description: Peel 2 of the mangoes and remove the flesh from the pit. Place the mango and syrup in a blender, and puree until smooth.

title: Ice Cream with Mixed Berries
description: Mix the cream quark and softened ice cream together until smooth. Scoop the ice cream mixture into small dessert bowls and spoon the berry mixture over the top. Sprinkle with the toasted almonds, garnish with tort wafers and serve immediately.

title: Vanilla Pears with Almond and Pistachio Bananas
description: Take out the pears from the juices and simmer the juices over low heat until syrupy.

title: Mixed Berry Salad with Pistachios
description: Spoon the berry salad into small dessert bowls, top with a scoop of vanilla ice cream, if desired, and serve.

title: Quick Cherry Dessert
description: Place 3 ladyfingers on each dessert plate. Pour the cherries on top.

title: Chocolate Muffins
description: Line a muffin tin with paper cups and grease wiith the cups with oil. Pour the batter into the muffin tin. Bake for 25-30 minutes. Remove from the oven, let cool and serve.

title: Mango Melon Parfait
description: Squeeze juice from lime. Mix half the juice and 1 teaspoon of vanilla sugar with fruit.

title: Cheesecake with Peaches
description: Pour batter into springform pan. Bake in the oven about 25 minutes. Loosen the side of the springform pan and cool on a wire rack. Soak gelatin for 5 minutes in cold water. Mix sour cream, cream cheese, powdered sugar and lemon zest together. Heat lemon juice.

title: Apple Pudding with Almonds
description: Peel, halve and cut out the core of the apples. Place apples with the cut side up in a buttered baking dish. Rinse the berries, remove stems and pat dry. Mix with 2 tablespoons of sugar and the lemon juice and add in the apples.

title: Yogurt Cream with Honey and Berries
description: Stir the crushed berries into the remaining yogurt. Divide between four glasses. Add the blackberries as garnish and squeeze honey on top as garnish.

title: Vanilla and Chocolate Pudding with Cherries
description: For the cherries: Rinse, pit and halve the cherries. Distribute 3/4 of the cherries between the glasses.

title: Apple-Fig Crumble
description: Peel and quarter the apples then cut out the core and slice. Finely chop the figs finely and sauté briefly in 1 tablespoon of melted butter with the apple slices and 1 tablespoon of brown sugar. Pour in the apple juice and lemon juice and cook for about 10 minutes until the apple slices are soft. Stir in the cinnamon and divide into the casserole dishes.

title: Plum and Nut Crumble
description: Rinse the plums, cut in half, remove the pits and spread into a buttered baking dish. Zest the lemon, squeeze out the juice and mix both with the liqueur and honey. Drizzle over the plums and stir to combine.

title: Candied Oranges
description: Rinse the oranges in hot water, pat dry and cut into 3-4 mm (approximately 1/6 inch) thin slices. Lay on a perforated plate or colander and into a flat shape or a sheet. Cover with the syrup and let rest about 12 hours. Pour off the syrup, boil again and let cool slightly. pour on the oranges again and leave for another 12 hours. Then take the oranges from the syrup and allow to drain on a rack. Allow to dry for 1-2 days.

title: Tiramisu
description: Chill for at least 3 hours, preferrably overnight. Sprinkle heavily with cocoa powder and serve.

title: Basil and Avocado Ice Cream
description: Halve avocados, remove pits and scoop out flesh. In a blender, combine avocado with lemon juice. Strain sugar syrup through a sieve and add to blender. Puree until smooth. Whisk together puree with cream and ricotta. Transfer mixture to a metal container and freeze 4 hours, stirring frequently to prevent large ice crystals from forming. (Alternatively, process mixture in an ice cream maker, according to manufacturer's instructions.) Scoop into bowls and garnish with basil leaves.

title: Pear Chips
description: Rinse the pears, then thinly slice lengthwise. Place the the pear slices on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper and brush with the lemon juice. Bake in the oven for 4-5 hours with the oven door slightly ajar. You can do this by propping open the door with a wooden spoon. In the last 5-10 minutes of cooking, sprinkle the pears with the powdered sugar, and continue to cook until caramelized. Remove from the oven, let cool, and serve.

title: Easy Orange Sorbet
description: Add the orange juice to the cooled syrup mix. Stir the lemon juice into the mixture. Whisk the egg white until half stiff and fold into the mixture. Place sorbet in a flat metal pan and freeze at least 4 hours in the freezer. Stir well every 30 minutes,or finish in an ice cream machine.

title: Potato and Pear Fritters with Fruit Sauce
description: Rinse and drain the blackberries. Rinse the orange in hot water and wipe dry. Finely grate the zest and squeeze the juice. Caramelize the sugar in a small saucepan. Deglaze with the orange juice and blackberry juice. Add the orange zest and simmer for 2-3 minutes. Add the blackberries and remove from the heat. Let cool.

title: Cherry Clafouti with Chocolate
description: Preheat oven to 180°C (approximately 350°F). Butter an ovenproof baking dish.

title: Buttermilk Blueberry Gelatin
description: Soften the gelatine in cold water. Take the blueberries from the heat and stir in the squeezed gelatine until it has dissolved. Remove the vanilla pod. Mix in about 200 ml of buttermilk (approximately 7 ounces). Spread the remaining buttermilk in a bowl and pour the blueberry mixture into it. Mix with the fork and refrigerate at least 4 hours.

title: Baked Apples
description: Crumble speculoos and mix with butter, raisins and almonds in a bowl. Cut apricots into strips. Add apricots and pistachios to biscuit and nut mixture.

title: Grilled Plums
description: Stick the plum pieces on skewers and cook on a hot grill with indirect heat for about 10 minutes. Serve hot with scoop of ice cream for a real treat.

title: Summer Pudding
description: Cut off crust from white bread. Cut into strips and line pudding  pan with half of bread (14 cm in diameter) (approximately 6 inches). Fill with berries and cover with the rest of white bread. Weigh down with a plate and refrigerate for 4 hours.

title: Shortbread Cookie
description: Roll the dough into logs about 4 cm (approximately 1 1/3 inch) in diameter. Cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate for 30 minutes.

title: Sorbet from Apples
description: Then arrange frozen apple sorbet in glasses and serve garnished with mint leaves and lemon wedges.

title: Mixed Party Skewers
description: Rinse the star fruit and slice. Cut the salami into 2 cm (approximately 3/4 inch) long pieces. Alternate all ingredients on wooden party skewers. Serve in glasses.

title: Strawberry Cream Charlotte
description: Line a small bowl (750 ml capacity) (25 ounces) with plastic wrap, cut the ladyfingers diagonally and use to line the bowl. Pour in the strawberry mousse, cover and chill for 5 hours in the refrigerator.

title: Cherry Crepes
description: Beat the eggs, milk and maple syrup together, then stir in the flour and cocoa powder. Let the batter rest for about 20 minutes.

title: Oatmeal Cookies with Peanuts
description: Grease a 18 x 18 cm (approximately 7 x 7 inch) pan, add the dough, and flatten it.

title: Mini Pancakes with Pears
description: Bake the pear slices in the oven on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper at 180°C (approximately 350°F) for about 10 to 15 minutes.

title: Blueberry Salad with Pine Nuts and Loquat
description: Rinse blueberries. Peel the loquat peel, remove the seeds and membrane, and cut into eighths. Mix with the remaining lemon juice and blueberries and divide into 4 bowls.

title: Melon with Cream
description: Drizzle each serving with 1 teaspoon of honey and garnish with lemon balm.

title: Coating Muffins with Chocolate
description: Brush the melted chocolate over the cooled muffins. Brush on several times after the first layer has set.

title: Soufflé with Baked Apples
description: Rinse lemon in hot water, pat dry and finely grate half of peel. Mix lemon zest with dry fruit-almond paste. Mix well. Squeeze juice from lemon and sprinkle apples with lemon juice. Place apples in the baking dish, fill apples with dry fruit mixture using a small spoon. Preheat oven to 175°C (approximately 350°F).

title: Chocolate Dessert with Yogurt Cream and Apricots
description: Spread parchment paper on a work surface and place the foil strips parallel, with some distance between them. Drizzle thinly with chocolate (about 2 mm / approximately 1/10 inch) and leave to dry for about 10 minutes.

title: Grill-Baked Apples
description: Mix the cranberries with the orange liqueur and orange zest. Then mix the cranberries with the jelly and the walnuts and fill the apples. Place each apple on a piece of foil brushed with melted butter. Top each apple with butter flakes and wrap up in the foil. Cook the apples in the foil on a hot grill for 20-25 minutes. Then carefully unwrap the apples and serve warm.

title: Chocolate Ice Cream with Cherries
description: Separate egg and place egg whites in a large bowl and refrigerate. Put egg yolks in a bowl, add powdered sugar whisk over a hot water bath until thickened. Add melted chocolate. Then beat chocolate mixture over an ice water bath until cooled.

title: Fruit Smoothie
description: Put everything in a blender along with the yogurt, milk, lemon juice and honey and purée until creamy.
types: ['Pome Fruit', 'Beverage', 'Mixed Drink', 'Smoothie', 'Fruit Smoothie', 'Apple Smoothie', 'banana smoothie', 'Herb', 'Fruit', 'Tropical Fruit', 'Dessert']

title: Melon Strawberry Popsicles
description: You can dip these in chocolate for added decadence!

title: Rice Pudding with Apples
description: Peel two apples, quarter and core. Cut into thin slices. Mix with lemon juice, 1 tablespoon of sugar and cinnamon. Let stand.

title: Berry Tartlets
description: Mix the flour and butter until crumbly. Add the salt and marsala. Knead into a smooth dough. Form the dough into a ball and wrap in plastic wrap. Chill for 1 hour. Preheat the oven to 180°C (approximately 350°F). Grease the tart tins with butter and sprinkle with flour. Roll out the dough between plastic wrap. Cut out 8 rounds and fit into tart tins, trimming flush with rim. Bake for about 20 minutes until golden brown. Remove from the oven and let cool.

title: Cold Strawberry Soup with Tapioca
description: Combine the coconut milk, cream and 4 tablespoons sugar and boil, then lower heat, add the tapioca and let simmer for about 20 minutes while stirring, until the pearls are transparent. Remove from the heat and let cool.

title: Parfait with Baked Apple
description: Boil the sugar and 2 tablespoons of water until syrupy, remove from heat, let cool slightly, then add the yolks and beat to a loose cream. Place chocolate hazelnut spread in a pot, melt slowly and stir in the almonds and brandy with the pudding.

title: Cherry Cream
description: Strain the juice into another pot and bring to a boil again. Mix the cornstarch with a little water until smooth and use it to thicken the juice.

title: Berry Jelly with Vanilla Custard
description: Beat egg yolks with sugar in a bowl until creamy.

title: Baked Stuffed Apples
description: Preheat the oven to 175°C (approximately 350°F).Rinse the lemon, pat dry and grate half of the zest into the dried fruit-almond mixture. Mix well. Squeeze the lemon squeeze over the apples. Place the apples in the baking dish, and spoon the filling into the cored apples.

title: Mixed Berry Gelée
description: Mix a little of the currant juice into the gelatin mixture, then mix in the remaining juice. Pour the mixture over the berries and chill in the refrigerator for 3 hours. Dip the ramekins into hot water to release the gelées before serving.
types: ['Jelly', 'cooking for one', 'Red Currant Jelly', 'Fruit', 'Dessert', 'gelatin-based dish', 'Fruit Dessert', 'dessert']

title: Strawberry Pistachio Cream Cake
description: Remove from heat and allow to cool while stirring. Coarsely chop the dried fruit. Beat the remaining cream until stiff and fold into the warm mixture. Fold 1/3 of the cream mixture with the chopped pistachios. Fold the remaining cream mixture with the strawberry puree and chopped fruit. Line a dome-shaped terrine mold and place the pistachio cream in.

title: Chocolate Black and White Cookies
description: Cut thick slices of the dough and place on a greased baking sheet. Bake for 20 minutes at 200°C (approximately 400°F). Remove from the oven and let cool.

title: Rhubarb Raspberry Gelatin
description: Squeeze water from gelatin. Place 1/2 liter (approximately 17 ounces) of apple juice in a pan. Add gelatin, heat and dissolve gelatin into juice. Mix raspberries and rhubarb into gelatin mixture. Pour into a loaf pan 28 cm (approximately 11 inches) in length and chill for 4 hours.

title: Pineapple Rice Pudding
description: Cook the rice with the milk according to the package directions. Cool and stir in the egg yolk mixture. Beat the egg whites until very stiff and fold into the rice. Chop half of the lemon balm finely and add.

title: Baked Pear in Pastry
description: Rinse pears, peel, cut out cores, sprinkle with lemon juice and fill with gorgonzola.

title: Sherbet Stars
description: Boil sugar with 5 tablespoons water in a small pot until syrupy. Allow sugar syrup to cool and mix in equal parts with kiwi puree and raspberry puree. Add lime juice and zest equally into each puree. Beat egg white until stiff and fold evenly into both purees. Pour kiwi and raspberry puree into strips side by side in a flat metal mold or on a small baking sheet and allow to freeze in the freezer.

title: Quick Poppy Dumplings with Cherry Sauce
description: Divide dough into 8 dumplings. Cook in lightly salted water, according to package instructions.

title: Vanilla Raspberry Cream
description: Beat egg yolks with the sugar in a bowl until creamy. Mix flour into egg yolks.

title: Orange Crêpes
description: Rinse and dry strawberries wash, hull and halve. Sprinkle with half of vanilla sugar and let stand for a bit. Peel and core mangoes, puree pulp and strain through a sieve. Combine with remaining vanilla sugar.

title: Red Berry Dessert
description: Pick over raspberries and brush off any dirt, but do not wash!

title: Crêpes with Strawberry Filling
description: Grease a pan and fry about 10 thin crêpes. Keep warm.

title: Chocolate Pudding with Custard Sauce
description: Heat the rest of the milk in the saucepan, stir in chocolate, boil, and add the cornstarch-milk mixture. simmer 1 minute.

title: Semolina Tart with Cherries and Kiwis
description: Grease the springform pan. Roll out the dough slightly larger than the prepared pan and use to line the pan, forming a 4 cm (approximately 2-inch) high rim. Chill. For the filling: Strain the cherries. Mix the cottage cheese with the sugar, vanilla, lemon zest, eggs, semolina and cream until smooth. Fold in the cherries, transfer to the tart shell, smooth the surface and bake in a preheated oven at 170°C (approximately 325°F) for about 1 hour.

title: Frozen Chocolate and Berry Bombe
description: Before serving, remove the bombe and let stand at room temperature for 5 minutes to soften slightly. Invert onto a serving plate, remove the plastic wrap, decorate with raspberries and dust with powdered sugar.

title: Coconut Tapioca Pudding with Mango Sauce
description: Bring the coconut milk, soy creamer, and sugar to a boil. Add the shredded coconut and reduce the heat to the lowest setting. Add the tapioca and simmer over low heat for about 20 minutes while stirring, until the tapioca is transparent. Then pour into jars and chill in the refrigerator at least 2 hours.

title: Dark Chocolate Raspberry Cake
description: For the dough: chop chocolate coarsely and melt over hot water bath, let cool slightly. Beat butter and powdered sugar until fluffy. Separate eggs. Gradually add egg yolks and melted chocolate into butter. Beat egg whites with sugar until stiff, carefully fold into chocolate mixture. Combine flour with almonds and fold into chocolate mixture as well. Pour batter into springform pan and bake in preheated oven at 180°C (approximately 350°F) for 40-45 minutes. Cool and remove from mold.

title: Triple Layer Chocolate Pudding
description: Return the mixture to the saucepan and bring to a simmer.

title: Strawberry Rice Pudding
description: Rinse, pat dry and hull strawberries. Cut strawberries into pieces. Divide berries among four bowls. Remove lemon zest and vanilla bean from rice. Divide rice pudding over strawberries and let cool completely.

title: Small Chocolate Nut Cakes
description: Chop the chocolate and melt over a hot water bath. Separate the eggs and beat the whites with the lemon juice until stiff. Cream the butter with the sugar until smooth. Gradually add the egg yolks and add the cooled chocolate. Chop half of the walnuts coarsely, and grind the remaining finely. Mix the flour with the chopped and ground nuts, then mix into the batter. Fold in the egg whites, then pour the batter into the glasses and bake for about 40 minutes, until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.

title: Homemade Gingerbread
description: For the dough, beat the eggs and sugar until frothy. Finely chop the candied lemon and orange and slowly stir into the egg mixture. Stir the jam and marzipan until smooth. Stir into the egg mixture. Stir in the honey and lemon zest. Mix the nuts, flour, crumbs, baking powder and gingerbread spice. Fold into the dough.

title: Chocolate Souffle
description: Chop chocolate coarsely and melt in a bowl over hot water bath, cool slightly. Add butter and mix well.

title: Strawberry-rhubarb Compote
description: Rinse strawberries, hull, cut into quarters or eighths, mix with remaining sugar and the lemon juice and also marinate 30 minutes, stirring occasionally so that the sugar dissolves.

title: Whipped Cream with Strawberries
description: Beat the cream and stabilizer until stiff and fold into the yogurt. Pour into a piping bag with a large star tip and squirt in dessert glasses. Cover with the strawberry puree, without stirring. Chill until ready to serve. Garnish with one quartered strawberry, mint and chocolate curls.

title: Iced Coffee with Ice Cream
description: Bring the milk, cream, and half of the sugar to a boil. Mix the egg yolks, egg, and remaining sugar in a metal bowl. Place over a hot water bath, and beat until foamy. Add the milk and cream mixture to the egg mixture and whisk until combined. Melt the chocolate, then add to the egg mixture with the cocoa powder and the nuts. Place the mixture into an ice cream machine. Alternatively, you can place the mixture in a shallow metal pan and place in the freezer. Freeze for at least 4 hours, stirring frequently.

title: Chocolate Triffles
description: Separate the eggs. Beat the egg yolks with the vanilla sugar until fluffy.

title: Risotto with Apricots, Raspberries and Pistachios
description: Heat milk until just under boiling. Slit the vanilla bean lengthwise, scrape out seeds and halve beans again crosswise.

title: Green Popsicles
description: Rinse the spinach and mache thoroughly. Rinse the mint and pluck off the leaves. Put together with the fruit and vegetables in the blender and puree.

title: Elderflower Fritters with Raspberry Puree
description: Put 100 grams (approximately ½ cup) raspberries aside. Puree the remaining raspberries with sugar, lemon juice and mineral water, and strain through a sieve.

title: White Wine Poached Pears
description: Dissolve the sugar in a little water and simmer for 5 minutes over low heat. Add the wine and pears and simmer, covered, for about 15 minutes until tender.

title: Stuffed Strawberries with Yogurt Sauce
description: Roll almond and date mixture into approximately 0.5 cm (approximately 0.2 inch) thick roll and cut into 12 pieces, small enough to fit inside strawberries.

title: Souffle with Cherries
description: Combine quark with egg yolks, vanilla, cherry brandy and lemon zest, mix until smooth. Beat egg whites with a pinch of salt until very stiff and gradually add sugar. Carefully fold egg whites into  quark mixture.

title: Mascarpone Mousse in Chocolate Rings
description: Line work surface with parchment paper. Place parallel strips of foil on work surface, leaving space between each. Sprinkle foil strips with chocolate and let sit for about 10 minutes. Allow to dry. Pull foil strips carefully from baking paper and turn chocolate sides inward to form circles the size of small souffle cups. Squeeze ends of foil together well and fasten with paperclips. Place chocolate rings back on baking paper, leave in cool place to solidify completely, unfasten paperclips and carefully separate chocolate rings from foil.

title: Berry Bombe with Amaretto Macaroons
description: Purée remaining strawberries with orange zest and juice. Cream mascarpone and cream cheese together and add to strawberry purée. Mix. Pour mixture into cups and freeze approximately 4 hours. 15 minutes before serving, remove from freezer and place in refrigerator. Serve with whipped cream and crumbled amaretto macaroons.

title: Strawberry Popsicles
description: 300 mins

title: Chocolate Fig Buttercream Cake
description: Beat the egg whites with the salt until stiff. Gently fold into the chocolate mixture. Mix the flour, cornstarch and baking powder. Gently fold the flour mixture into the chocolate mixture.
